Chinnerau is requesting his first loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike and a passenger trailer to drive a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a passenger trailer to drive a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.name: Tiem

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiem K. is a villager in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Um Vath, is a construction worker. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their household.

In order to improve their income, Mrs. Tiem K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is a 35-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Kitimbwa Mixed Group

texts.en:
Proscovia Nairuba is a wedding coordinator. She does all the arranging of the wedding cake, the wedding clothes, and the decorations. In Uganda, it is traditional for special gift baskets to be prepared and given to the bride and groom in a very ceremonial way at the wedding. These baskets should be covered with decorations that match the decorations at the rest of the wedding. All of the cars involved in a wedding also have some ribbon tied around that matches the wedding’s colors. Proscovia is responsible for all of these arrangements.

For the wedding clothes, Proscovia has a dress that she rents out for 100,000 USH. This allows her to make a large profit because she can either loan her own, which makes her the most money, or she can rent one from a friend for about 40,000 USH. This means that she can earn anywhere between 60,000 – 100,000 USH just on the clothing for the wedding. Then for decorations she can earn anywhere from 80,000 – 100,000 profit per wedding.

Proscovia has 2 workers that help her with all of the arrangements needed for this business. She also has a side business selling women’s tops and bracelets. She employs two people who sell these items for her in the surrounding markets.

Proscovia and her husband have 3 kids together that they care for, and she has one, who is the oldest, that is just hers and that she provides everything for. With the money that she makes, she is now able to send this oldest girl to boarding school. This is a dream come true for her.

Proscovia is requesting a loan of 700,000 USH to purchase two veils for weddings she is coordinating this month. She will also use part of the loan to buy some more women’s tops and bracelets for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase 2 veils, some women's tops, and some bracelets

loans.name: Fulvia

texts.es:
La Señora Fulvia G. es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Pai. Ella tiene su casa propia. Fulvia tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera con 4 hijos, queines son todos mayores de edad y que trabajan en forma independientes.

Se dedica en las compras y ventas de productos de carne en el mercado municipal de Santani. Tiene buenos ingresos, mediante una buena clientela y buenos servicios.

Posee exelentes referencias comerciales y personales, es una señora muy trabajadora y conocida en el barrio.  El cliente sueña en construir un salon de material en su domicilio para poner su negocio y asi poder trabajar desde su propia casa.
texts.en:
Fulvia G. lives in the City of San Estanislao, Ycua Pai Neighborhood. She is a home owner. Fulvia is 48 years old. She is single and she has 4 children, all of them of age and independent. She buys and sells meat products in the municipal market in Santani. Her income is fairly good, as she has a nice clientele and she provides good service. She has excellent business and personal references. She is very hard working and well known in her neighborhood. Her dream is to build a new brick room in her house to open a shop and, then, be able to work from home

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room in her business

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr: Akpene K. est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle est productrice et revendeuse de jus de fruits au bord de la route à Lomé. Elle livre aussi ses produits à d’autres revendeuses. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de on commerce afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle bénéficie de son premier crédit chez FECECAV et promet des remboursements à temps.
texts.en:
Akpene K. is a young women, 35 years old, married, and the mother of a boy. She produces and sells fruit juices along side the road to Lomé. She also delivers her goods to other retailers. She would like to use this loan to increase her business capacity in order to respond better to the needs of her customers. She’s benefiting from her first loan with FECECAV and promises to make the payments on time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and a refirgerator

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A. is 32 years old, married and has three children, all currently in school. He makes a living selling spare parts for cars, and is also an auto electrician. He buys spare parts in bulk, and retails them to his customers. As a result of his rich experience as an auto electrician, he has earned the trust and confidence of many clients, who come to service their vehicles in his shop.

John enjoys his trade very much, but does not have enough money to support his family as he would like, especially because many of the parts he buys have gone up in price lately. He has applied for a loan to buy a new stock of spare parts and scrap metal to sell to his customers. He believes that this loan will allow him to save more to finance his children's education and also build his own shop. John is a member of a loan group called Mawulawe (which means "things are in God's hands") Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee and support one another when making loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and scrap metal in bulk to sell to his customers

loans.name: Zirahon

texts.ru: Набиева Зирахон-1965 года рождения, замужем,  имеет 3-х детей . Её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы там зарабатывать деньги, как и многие рабочие мигранты, которые не могут найти здесь нормальную работу. Зирахон  занимается продажей мелких товаров ,таких как хозяйственные товары, электроприборы и т . д. Её торговая точка расположена  на Центральном рынке Спитаменского района и поэтому торговля у нее идет хорошо. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Zirahon N. is married and has 3 children. Her husband went to Russia to earn money, just like many migrant workers, who could not find work here at home. Zirahon is involved in sales of small goods, such as household products, electric appliances, etc. Because her retail outlet is located at the Central market of the Spitamen district, her sales are going well. Zirahon wants to expand her business and open one more retail store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open another store

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mr. Mai R., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Sarum Tun, 44, have been married since 1985. They have five children: three sons (all of whom are construction workers), two daughters (one is in school and another daughter is still young). The family lives along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mai has been a construction worker for over 20 years. He works in his village and in the nearby district. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He hopes to support his daughters’ further education. Mai’s materials and tools are old and some parts break down; it upsets his business because he cannot work smoothly. The construction work is the main source of income for the family. So, he is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase new construction materials and tools to continue the business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and tools for his business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro S. is 47 years old. He was born in Chanuancolo, but now lives in Boane. He is married and has one child who is 17 years old.

Pedro was forced to end his studies at the conclusion of high school as he could not afford the costs of going to the university and scholarships were not available to him. He has worked as a clerk at MINED (Mozambique Ministry of Education) since 1986.

This will be Pedro's first loan with Hluvuku. He intends on using this loan to continue construction of his home. He dreams about being able to save up enough money to have a fund that he can use in times of crisis.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Мухаррам - женщина средних лет, ей 40 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Мухаррам вместе с мужем занимаются производством и продажей национальных лепешек. Её муж печет дома лепешки а Мухаррам продает их на базаре и принимает заказы от потенциальных клиентов. Мухаррам и мужу помогают дети. Из дома до рынка лепешки отвозит их старший сын. У сына сейчас летние каникулы. Мухаррам и её муж хотят закупить парию муки примерно 15-20 мешков. Для этого Мухаррам просит займ в размере 1200 сомони.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Muharram is a middle age woman, she is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother of three children. Muharram together with her husband make and sell traditional flat breads. Her husband bakes the flat breads at home and Muharram sells them on the market and takes orders from potential customers. Muharram and her husband's children help them. Their oldest son delivers the flat breads from home to the market. Their son is on summer recess right now. Muharram and her husband want to purchase a stock of flour of approximately 15-20 bags. Muharram is requesting a loan for amount of 1200 somoni for this reason.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour for baking of flat breads

loans.name: Rhea Joy

texts.en:
Rhea Joy F. is a 31-year-old mother of three children, ages 1 to 8 years old. She is married to a 33-year-old grocery worker and together with their children, they live in a beautiful village near the seashore in the municipality of Hamtic in the province where mountains meet the sea: Antique.

Rhea started earning her own income and independence from the income of her husband when she became a member of ASHI in 2005. She made a loan then, which she used as capital to start up her fish selling business. After several years of loaning and savings generated from her profits, she had put up another business for an alternative source of income in case fish were off season. Now, her business has grown and requires a larger amount of capital. Thus, Rhea Joy's loan amounting to Php 24,000 is intended for this purpose. Since fish is in demand, she wants to increase her inventory of it and also wants to finance her variety store.

By obtaining loans and being a member of ASHI, Rhea Joy wishes to make her business more stable and sustainable. She also dreams of sending all of her children to college with the profits her business generates and through the savings she makes in ASHI.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of fish to resell and to use a small portion of the loan to finance her variety store business.

loans.name: Cagumbay

texts.en:
Cagumbay H. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Cagumbay is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Cagumbay owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cagumbay has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cagumbay joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cagumbay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cagumbay is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cagumbay from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her store's product offering

loans.name: Isidora Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Isidora Narcisa  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima”, del  distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 55 años D. edad,  es casada y vive actualmente  con su esposo,  tiene 4 hijos, 1 D. ellos  tiene su familia pero todos viven al lado D. ella están al amparo D. su madre ya que todavía no trabajan, ella  tiene estudios D. primaria completa (6to grado)

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más D. un año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para adquirir insumos para la preparación D. venta D. comida ya que ella tiene un puesto D. venta D. comida en el mercado D. juli.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 300.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas productos e insumos para implementar su negocio D. comida.

Su sueño es salir adelante, que sus hijos sean buenos  profesionales para que no tengan problemas económicos en el futuro.

Del Banco Comunla. le gustan los ahorros, sus ganancias y los temas educativos a la vez piD. que los próximos temas D. capacitación sean en la preparación D. diferentes platos lo cual le serviría mucho en el futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Isidora Narcisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa D. Lima”, which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 55 years old, married, and has 4 children. One child has a family, but they all live nearby and help their mother because they still do not have jobs. Sra. Isidora has a 6th graD. education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for more than a year. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used to purchase supplies for preparing food that she sells from her vending stall in the Juli Market.

She is currently requesting another loan of 300 soles to purchase additional products and supplies for her food business.

Sra. Isidora dreams of getting ahead and that her children become successful professionals who do not have financial problems in the future. She enjoys her profits and the savings and educational seminars provided by her Communal Bank. Her next training session will cover the preparation of different dishes, which should benefit her greatly in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana, pertenece al banco comunal, TAMBOPATA DE TIPON; ubicado en el distrito de Oropeza, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis, en el departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 1 hijo, ella está separada de su pareja y es madre soltera, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene en su casa un espacio dedicado para la crianza de pollos, ella cría aves de corral y está pensando en la crianza de cuyes, para su futura venta, la socia se dedica a este negocio puesto que ella vive en una zona bastante comercial,  llamada Tipón, está situada junto a un bellísimo complejo arqueológico, que fuese construido en la época de los inkas, el cual servia de adoratorio al agua, ellos amaban la naturaleza y le dedicaban un templo a cada deidad natural, alrededor de este complejo se estableció un pequeño pueblo llamado tipón, aprovechando que esta a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, con una vista espectacular del paisaje, todas las familias se reúnen los fines de semana para deleitar platos típicos de Perú y en cocinas a leña y carbón. Nuestra socia aprovecho este punto para hacer su pequeño negocio.

Ella agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the Tambopata de Tipon community bank located in the district of Oropeza, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco. She is a single mother with one son and is separated from her partner. Ana alternates her household duties with that of a livestock merchant. She has a space in her home dedicated to raising chickens. She raises them in the yard and is also considering raising guinea pigs to sell in the future.

Ana lives in Tipón, a rather commercial area situated next to a beautiful archeological complex that was built during the Incan era that served as a shrine to water. The Incas loved nature and dedicate a temple to every natural deity. Surrounding the complex is the small town of Tipón, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco and has a spectacular view of the countryside. All of families meet on the weekends to enjoy traditional Peruvian meals cooked over firewood or charcoal. Ana takes advantage of this meeting spot to set up her small business.

Ana is grateful for the support she has received from microlenders and promises to fulfill her payment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin P. is a group leader of six members who all live in Prech village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a fish middle woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fishes to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Vin P. is 33 years old widow with a child who is attending the local school. 
Three members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: By purchasing more fishes to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia A. is now 53 years old and married to her partner in life and in business, Celso A.. He is also 53 years old. They were given four daughters. April is now 27 years old, Gerlie is 24 years old, Babylyn is 20 years old and Baby Jean is 18 years old. Their oldest daughter is now working as a teacher and their youngest is still studying. The two in the middle are helping them in their business. They are glad that their oldest daughter is helping the youngest with her educational expenses. But Herminia doesn’t want her daughter to feel obligated to do that. She and her husband want to be the ones to provide for the family. Their main source of income is through their bamboo set making.

The business has been running for two years now and with the help of the loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), their business continues to run because she always properly utilizes her loan. Now she will use another loan to buy things the business needs like bamboo. Sometimes they’ll buy finished products like a bed made of bamboo. Then they will resell it, but most of the time they make and then sell the product or sometimes they do custom orders. Herminia dreams of having a successful business someday, and hopes that she and her husband will provide all the needs of all her children so that they will experience a better life.

loans.use: For additional capital for her bamboo set making business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro D. es casado con la señora Margarita Jiménez y son padres de familia de 3 hijos de edad escolar, ellos tienen un negocio establecido desde hace 8 años de nombre “Abarrotes July”, son una familia muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y están tramitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro D. is married to Sra. Margarita Jiménez. They are the parents of three school-aged children. They established a business eight years ago called “Abarrotes July”.

They are a hardworking and enterprising family in need of a loan in order to buy more merchandise for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana G. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo mucho ha surtir su negocio y que creciera más en las ventas.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar más mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda ropa de frío, y desea acondicionar otra local para que su hijo le ayude a vender en diferentes partes de la ciudad y así tener otro ingreso a la familia ya que tiene los gastos de los niños de la escuela. 
Ella planea pagar este crédito con las ganancias de la inversión ya que con el otro negocio será para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sra. Adriana G. is very grateful for your cooperation. Her previous loan helped her restock her business and increase her sales.

She is requesting a new loan so that she can buy more winter merchandise, since her customers are requesting clothes to wear for the cold weather. Adriana also wants to establish another location so that her son can help sell merchandise in a different part of the city. This business enables her to earn extra income to pay for the school expenses of her younger children.

Adriana plans to repay this loan with the earnings resulting from this investment. Her other business will cover her family expenses.

(Click HERE to view the previous loan.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan H. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread and brewing local alcohol in the market, and is requesting a loan to stock baking flour and sugar to sell. Juan is 23 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bakery. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock baking flour and sugar to sell

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.en:
M. Abdukholik is 26 years old, living with his wife and two children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 5 years and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk from his cows, which his wife sells in local markets. Abdukholik keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, along with his wife who helps him to care for the animals. Now Abdukholik needs a loan of $1100 USD to purchase more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Edilberta es viuda, tiene 56 años y 10 hijos, Edilberta vende golosinas en la puerta de un colegio, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado. Además Edilberta se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en su casa.
Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, chocolates.
Los sueños de Edilberta son que su hija sea policía, criar mas animales y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Edilberta is a member of the Pura Vida village bank. Edilberta is a widow. She is 56 años and has 10 children. From Monday to Saturday every week, she sells sweets from a three-wheeled cart outside a school. She also raises small animals in her house. Edilberta needs a loan of 900 soles, which she will use to buy cookies, candies, and chocolates. Her dreams are for her daughter to become a police officer, to raise more animals, and to open a shop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, candies, and chocolates

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas M. is 39 years old. She owns and manages a small sari-sari (variety) store in Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. She started selling goods in 2008. She is still pursuing her career in the sari-sari store business because it helps her family a lot with paying for the daily costs in their home. 

She would like to ask for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan for buying additional merchandise. In that way, it will be easy for her to offer her customers a wider selections with greater variety.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Billy

texts.en: Billy is 40 years old, married and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. His youngest child is four years old.  A hard-working man, he sells phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards at retail prices to his customers, and with his profits he hopes to expand his business in the future. Billy is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and phone accessories to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
Marisabel es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Marisabel es conviviente y tiene 29 años, Marisabel tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su pareja.
Marisabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
El sueño de Marisabel es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marisabel is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). She is 29 years old and in a common law marriage. Marisabel has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat. She manages her business every day with the help of her partner.

She needs a loan of 1000 PEN in order to buy school supplies. Marisabel dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Kenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Kenia  Del Carmen Aragón Z.. Es soltera sin hijos actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria. El crédito lo solicito para comprar materiales de construcción para iniciar la construcción de su casa. Ella expresa que la única manera de tener una casa es a través del financiamiento que hacen estas micro financieras las cuales proveen servico financieros de acuerdo al salario de cada cliente.
texts.en:
Kenia Del Carmen Aragón Z. is single and does not currently have children. She works as a primary school teacher. The loan she requests is to buy construction materials to start construction on her house. She says that the only way to have a house is through the loans that these micro-finance organizations make; they provide financial services according to the salary of each client.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials such as sand, cement, cement blocks and quarried stone

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.en:
Akuvi D. is a trained seamstress. She is 38 years old, is married to a teacher, and has three children.

Mrs. D. now works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo, selling fabrics and jewelry. She began this business in 1999 and is now requesting her second loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to resupply her stock of fabric and jewelry in order to keep up with her customers’ demands.

It is her great hope that not only her business, but her entire family will benefit from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric and jewelry

loans.name: Novemae

texts.en:
Mrs. Novamae C. is 24 years of age and a resident of P1 Garang, Tangub City. She is married to Arthur C. and blessed with 1 child, who is still an infant. Her husband is a motorcycle driver with an average earning of not less than P150.00.

Even though they have only one child, the couple was experiencing financial hardships. To help her husband, Novamae decided to engage in business and opened a sari-sari (variety) store, which is located in Molave, Zamboanga Del Sur with her mother as her business partner and receiving a monthly share of not less than P2,000.00.

Novamae joined the cooperative just this year, 2010. As a newly recognized member under the regular loan program, she is applying for an amount of P15,000.00 as her first loan, which will be used as the down payment on 1 motorcycle to be used for business. The future income will be used for loan repayment, savings, and daily needs. She is hoping that she can give her child a better future from the fruits of her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Down payment on one motorcycle

loans.name: Laila's Group

texts.en:
Laila U. is from the village of Brgy.Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Laila is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Laila is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Laila owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Laila has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Laila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Laila is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Laila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher folk and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts to make red palm oil

loans.name: Khna

texts.en:
Mrs. Khna S. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Daeu Rumdael village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Tom Ten, is a motorbike repairman, who earns some income to support the family. Mrs. Khna S. is the mother of three children: two are attending the local school, while the youngest one is 2 years old. 

Mrs. Khna S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda L. is a 59-year-old woman from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 25 years now.

In 2006, Merlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Merlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  unas señoras de escasos recursos conformaron su comité para trabajar en grupo dentro del programa  Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a varias actividades.
Las integrantes necesitan de la ayuda crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria Isabel quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas, la venta lo realiza especialmente los fines de semana, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas de varios tipos como vino, cervezas, licores y otros.
texts.en:
A group of low income women from the city of Carapeguá decided to form a committee to work within the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) committee’s program. These women are very active and hard working; they are in a variety of commercial activities. The members need financial help to invest in their various jobs so that they can reach sustainable growth that will make it possible for them to grow as a group and individually. One of the members is María Isabel who sells beverages. Her sales are especially good on weekends and she is asking for funds to buy assorted beverages like: wine, beer, liquor, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages like: wine, beer, liquor, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more soap and slippers to sell to his customers

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Antonio labora para MATECSA en el área de producción elaborando adoquines.
Estos créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL han sido utilizado para compra de materiales de construcción, cin , perlin, cemento, hierro.
Las obras han consistido en mantenimiento y reparación de la vivienda ya que estaba en muy mal estado esto se ha venido mejorando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio is employed by MATECSA (a building materials firm) in the production department making paving stones. He has used CEPRODEL loans to buy building materials like: zinc metal sheeting, edging, cement, iron rods. The projects have been home maintenance and repair in that it was in very poor state and he has been making gradual improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvement.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es: Ignacia, de 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. La actividad que realiza es la agricultura y como visualizó que su producto tiene mucha demanda, dejo a cargo de su esposo para que administre el trabajo, mientras ella se dedicaba en instalar una pequeña tienda. Desde entonces atiende a sus clientes, procura siempre mantenerla abastecida de productos y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus compradores. Se encuentra muy satisfecha por lo logros que obtiene, eso le hace sentir una persona independiente, aunque en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo. Su plan a futuro es poder ampliar su negocio, con la necesidad de que pueda mejorar en cuanto a ventas y mejorar sus ingresos con respecto a las anteriores ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta satisfecha con su banco comunal, ya que le dá mucha tranquilidad y comodidad. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías, de esa manera pueda abastecer su negocio de abarrotes y no tenga ningún contratiempo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 54-years-old. She's married and has 6 children in her care. They live together in their own home the town of Quimbiri, located in the Peruvian tropical rain forest. She works in agriculture and her product is in high demand. She leaves agriculture work to her husband while she runs a small store. She attends to her customers and always tries to keep her store stocked up and to offer a good service to her buyers. She's very satisfied with her achievements because they make her feel like an independent person, even though on occasions she receives help from her children and husband. Her plan for the future is to be able to expand her business by improving her sales and income. This is her first loan with MFP and she's committed to continuing to meet the time line of payments. Furthermore, she's happy with her communal bank because it gives her peace of mind and comfort. With this loan she's requesting she's going to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her store with groceries so that she can serve her customers in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with various products

loans.name: Amistad (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama amistad  (flat), y está ubicado  en tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, se conforma de cuatro señoras que cada una tiene diferente actividad, la razón del nombre que le pusieron al grupo es porque llevan a una amistad de muchos años.

      La señora maría dolores Gomes López, tiene 56 años de edad  es madre soltera tuvo cinco hijos tres mujeres y dos varones  quienes cuatro de ellos ya están casados y solo vive con ella el más pequeño Deiser de veintiún años de edad el cual estudia la preparatoria abierta ya que es el único que aporta para los gastos de su hogar.

      Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace diez años, el cual le ha ido bien desde que inicio esta actividad, la que la ha sacado adelante junto con su familia y así tiene ingresos para sus alimentos del diario, a un así también recibe apoyo de su hijo que trabaja en el campo para aportar y ella no se sienta sola trabajando.

      Su motivo a realizar esta actividad es para dedicar su tiempo y obtener su propio dinero para salir adelante, junto con su familia y comenta que lo ha logrado  con su  esfuerzo dedicación  a su negocio, que es lo que la saca de gastos pequeños.

      Con las ganancias que  obtiene de su venta del diario lo ahorra para comprar más mercancía  y surtir su negocio semanal, para que este en buena presentación y  su clientela se interese en comprara la mercancía y Día se valla incrementando, solventando sus gastos.

      Su sueño es que su negocio crezca día con día, para poder ahorrar más y construir un local especial para  que su clientela tenga más comodidad en escoger sus cosas a comprar, para eso también ponerle repello a su casa que es muy importante para ella.

      María Dolores  formo parte del grupo ya que una de sus vecinas  la invito a que se integrara al programa y trabajar el crédito e invertirlo en su negocio y con ello mismo obtener para pagarlo puntualmente.
 
      Las personas que integran el grupo son las siguientes:


    Tomasa Sánchez P.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para su cocina económica como son: pollos, mariscos, y verduras.
    María dolores Pérez López: invertirá el préstamo  para comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda de abarrotes como son: azúcar, arroz, aceite, frijol,
    Carolina Gómez Pérez: invertirá el  préstamo para la compra de pollos por reja, para venderlo aliñado (destazado).
    Rosa del Carmen Gómez Pérez: invertirá el préstamo para  la compra de ingredientes como son: carne, chile ancho, cebolla, vinagre,  para la elaboración de chorizo.
texts.en:
The Amistad (Friendship) group is located in Tecpatan, Chiapas, Mexico. It is made up of four women who each have a different business. The group chose this name because they have been friends for many years. Señora María Dolores Gomes López is 56 years old, a single mother of five children, three of them daughters, and two of them sons. Four of her children are already married and only the youngest still lives with her. Deiser is 21 years old and is a student in a pre-university course. He is the only one who contributes to household expenses. María has been selling groceries for the last ten years and all has gone well since the beginning. Together with her family she has made progress in life, and she has enough income to pay for food on a daily basis. She receives assistance from her one son who works in the fields, and she doesn’t feel that she works alone. María’s motivation for working is to use her time to obtain money to get ahead, along with her family. She comments that she has managed to succeed with her business because of her dedication and effort, and that’s how she has money for small expenses. Some of the money she earns from her business on a daily basis, she puts aside to buy more merchandise each week so that her stock looks good and her customers are interested in buying from her. Her dream is to see her business grow day by day so she can save more and build a better place for it. Then her customers will be able to shop in comfort. She also wants to put cement on the walls of her house, something that is very important to her. María Dolores became part of the group when one of her neighbours invited her to join the program and get a loan to invest in her business. The group is made up of the following people: Tomasa Sánchez P. will use the loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, seafood, and vegetables for her small food business. María Dolores Pérez López will use the loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, oil, and beans for her grocery store. Carolina Gómez Pérez will use the loan to buy chickens for grilling and then sell the pieces cooked and seasoned. Rosa del Carmen Gómez Pérez will use the loan to buy ingredients such as meat, chilies, onions, and vinegar to make chorizo sausages.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 35 years old. Lucina is married and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is aged 4. She buys and sells assorted fish in their community. She also dries some fish that she sells. Her family also owns a tricycle that her husband drives to transport people around their community. They also own a jukebox  that her neighbors rent during fiestas and other celebrations. 

Lucina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair their existing vehicle for better service and buy additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service and buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Del Éxito Group

texts.es: Doña Martha S. de treinta y ocho años de edad, casada, curso el sexto grado de primaria, tiene 4 hijos de diferentes edades el mayor de 16 y la mas pequeña de 6 años, su esposo se dedica  a la confección de pantalones y ella se dedica al comercio (Venta de carne de pollo) en el mercado  y ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en este negocio, ya que esta actividad la ayuda a obtener ganancias para poder colaborar con los gastos de su familia y la educación de sus hijos. Ella siempre sueña con un negocio grande  y contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de unas vecinas  y hermanas de la iglesia, organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MUJERES DEL ÉXITO, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes con el pensamiento que de ellas depende llegar a cumplir sus sueños y obtener éxito en sus negocios. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; venta de ropas típicas y Refacciones, en las escuelas de los lugares aledaños.  El préstamo doña Martha lo utilizará para capital de trabajo, y de esa forma incrementar sus ganancias y considera que con la ayuda de este crédito aumentara su negocio y obtendrá un mejor desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha S., 38, is married and finished 6th grade.  She has four children of various ages.  The oldest is 16 and the youngest is 6.  Her husband makes pants and she sells chicken meat in the market.  She has been in business for 10 years since this activity helps her earn profits that she can contribute towards household expenses and her children’s education.

She always dreams with having a large business and with enthusiasm, desire to stand out and with help from some neighbors and fellow church members, the decision to form a group to request a loan was made.

The communal bank is called “MUJERES DEL ÉXITO (Women of Success).  The name was chosen by all the members with the thought in mind that having their dreams come true and being successful in their businesses depends on each one of them.

The group has 10 female members who are in a variety of activities among which are: sale of typical costumes, sale of replacement parts, and teaching in neighboring villages.

Martha will use the loan as working capital to increase her profits.  She considers that help from this loan will increase his business leading to better personal and family development.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Nancy Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nancy, ella tiene 36 años de edad, en la actualidad se encuentra divorciada, de esta relación tuvo tres hijos de 15 -  13 y 10 años, los dos mayores están en colegio y el menor en escuela.
 
En su casa tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas, también vende tarjetas y recargas de teléfono, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h30 hasta las 22h00, dice que le va más o menos por lo que en su barrio no hay otras cabinas, en la actualidad quiere comprar e instalar el servicio de internet para brindar a sus clientes este servicio.

Este crédito es justamente para ayudar a comprar dos computadores e instalar el servicio de internet. Este es se segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio y comprar un carro algún día.
texts.en:
The village bank of Los Ceibos meets every fifteen days in the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. In this low-income urban area, people make their living by various means.

This is where we met Nancy, a 36-year-old woman who is currently divorced and has three children from this relationship. Her children are 15, 13 and 10 years old. The elder two are in middle school and the youngest is in elementary school.

She runs a phone booth business out of her home where she also sells calling cards and prepaid phone cards. She works every day from 7:30am to 10pm. She says it's going fairly well as there are no other phone booths in her neighborhood. Now she would like to purchase and set up internet services so that she'll be able to offer this service to her customers.

This loan is precisely intended to help her purchase two computers and to set up internet services. This is her second time working with the village bank, which she appreciates for the ease with which you can obtain loans.

She dreams of improving her business and buying a car one day.

loans.use: Purchase of two computers and internet installation

loans.name: Tinga Ole Lesiyio

texts.en:
Tinga has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last 11 years.  He is 26 years old, married to Sempeyo Ene Tinga and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 1st loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the  future,Tinga hopes to have a big animal farm and to become a leading supplier  of beef in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 10 calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Mareela L. S. is a 38-year-old mother of two. She lives in the San José, Costa Rica with her two children. She has worked for several years as a stylist specializing in nail services. She has taken formal classes and continues to take professional courses to keep up to date with the latest fashions and techniques. Over time, she has been able to slowly expand the services that she offers and increase the number of clients that she serves. Mareela enjoys her work because she feels that it is something that she is good at, as well as something she likes to do.  Additionally, because she works out of her house, she is able to care for her children and generate an income.  

Mareela is taking a loan from Fundacion Mujer to buy furniture for her business so that, while clients wait for their appointments, they will have somewhere to sit in her house.  She feels that this will allow her to expand and serve more clients.  It will also help her to reach her business and professional goals, which include having her own house, and studying more in an effort to further expand her business. 
 
Marleela feels that the biggest obstacle to the growth of her business is the fierce competition, because nail salons can be found on every corner of San José neighborhoods.  However, she has been able to overcome this challenge through her excellent customer service, personal attention, and high quality products and services.  She looks forward to the progress she will make by investing this loan in her business.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her nail salon

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum C. is a 25-year-old woman living in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She has a good skill for making bamboo lattice-work used for flooring, and she often gets orders from the villagers who live near her house or from other provinces. She can make an income of on average $1.25 per day.

Prum C. has a life partner in her husband who works in a brick kiln as a machinery controller and has a proper salary every month so that he can share in covering daily expenses for the family. This couple has four children, all of whom are single, living at home. 

In order to earn more profit, Prum C. is applying for a loan from Kiva to purchase more bamboo to make lattices to sell and she hopes to buy oil for putting in machinery.

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo to make lattices and oil for machinery

loans.name: Mie

texts.en:
Mie P., age 33, sells pigs, earning an income of USD $6.00 per day. P. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Her husband sells rice, earning an income of USD $5.00 per day. The family has to spend USD $55.00 on food, USD $2.00 on electricity, and USD $40.00 on other necessary expenses every month. 

P. is requesting a loan of USD $800 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es casada, tiene 42 años y tiene 5 hijos, ellos viven en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Rosa se dedica a la ganadería, ella vende sus animales menores en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta.  Rosa que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos, gaganado como por ejemplo vacas, gallinas y muchas animales más. 

Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, is married and has five children.  They live in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Rosa raises small farm animals that she sells at Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city in Anta.  Rosa hopes to get a 1500 new sol loan that she’ll use to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens and cattle like cows, chickens and many other animals.

Rosa is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been in operation for a year and is being well run by its governing board.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals like: guine pigs and chickens and cattle like cows, chickens and many other animals.

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Monsieur Salif D.  est un homme  qui est âgé de 40 ans et qui vit avec ses 4 enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle dans la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Afin de s’insérer dans le  tissu économique, Salif,  qui est enseignant de formation entreprena plusieurs activités mais sans succès. Alors il commença  à apprendre auprès de son frère, le commerce d’articles divers avant d’opter finalement pour le stockage commercialement des articles tels les céréales, le charbon de bois, les produits de cueillettes tels le néré, les noix d’acajou et sur commande des fruits et légumes tels les pastèques, les courges etc.  
Nanti  de 5 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il est très sollicité.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, Salif décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Salif  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 500 kg d’arachide et 4 sacs de niébé, auprès des paysans producteurs de Famana, Keleya et Ouroun qu’il stockera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il effectue sa vente au marché de Ouelesseboubou, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Salif D. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Salif D. is a 40-year old man who lives with his 4 children and his wife in a traditional family in the city of Ouelessebougou, a prefecture of Kati in the region of Koulikoro. 

In order to integrate himself into the local economy, Salif, a teacher by training, set out in various businesses without success. So he learned from his brother the business of selling a variety of merchandise before finally opting to start selling articles such as cereal grains, charcoal, harvest products, including nere nuts, cashews, and on order, fruits and vegetables such as watermelons and squash etc.

Benefiting from 5 years' experience in the field, he is high sought out. 

In his search for additional financial resources, Salif decided to join the credit program at the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). It is his first individual loan. 

Salif plans on using his loan to purchase 1 ton of corn, 500 kg of peanuts and 4 sacks of cowpeas from the producers of Famana, Keleya and Ouroun. He will stock his inventory for at least 2 months. He carries out his sales in the Ouelessebougou market in cash and rarely on credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. 

Salif D. expects to make a monthly income of 25.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan, to provide for the family's expenses and to reinvest the remaining portion into the business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, tiene  34 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután en este lugar vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad, posee un taller de electrónica, Carlos tiene 11 años de dedicarse al taller, sus trabajos mayormente los realiza a domicilio.
Él necesita un préstamo para comprar repuestos para la variedad de artículos que repara teniendo a la mano lo necesario para realizar los trabajos, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar con el taller, ya que tendrá los repuestos necesario para salir con los trabajos en menor tiempo.
Su objetivo es aumentar el servicio a los clientes, mejorando sus equipos electrónicos de forma ágil, obteniendo la preferencia de los clientes. Con su familia espera que al realizar un mejor trabajo sus ingresos sean mejor y pueda ofrecerles una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
34-year old Carlos lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután, with his wife and two children aged 10 and 14. He has run an electronics workshop for eleven years; most of his work is done from his home. 

Carlos needs a loan so he can have on hand the spares for the wide variety of items that he repairs. This would enable him to improve the workshop since he would have the necessary spares to complete the work in the least amount of time.

His goal is to offer even better service to his customers by having good electronic equipment so that they will choose to come to him. He also hopes that with a greater income he will be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair his taxi or purchase a new one

loans.name: Danyoon

texts.es: Danyoon, tiene 26 años. Él vive junto a su mamá Betty, su padre Dany y sus menores hermanos a los que apoya económicamente. En su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la siembra de cítricos como: naranja y tangelo, producto que acaba de sembrar, en una hectárea de terreno agrícola que heredó de sus padres. Los cuales gracias a su buen cuidado, los comercializa a los comerciantes mayoristas que llegan a su propio cultivo. Ahora según menciona está en plena recolección de frutas ya maduradas, para poder hacer la primera venta. Pero como desde niño le gusto la música, también trabaja desde hace 15 años, tocando piano en diferentes eventos artísticos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde es uno de los integrantes más jóvenes de su asociación. Danyoon, cuida constantemente sus cultivos, y aunque no tiene mucho tiempo, está pensando comprar con el crédito que solicita, varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos de cítricos.
texts.en:
Danyoon is 26 years old. He lives together with his mother Betty, with his father Dany, and his younger siblings, whom he supports financially. His house is located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian jungle). For the past 4 years he has been growing citrus fruits such as: oranges and tangelos. He has recently done his plantation on a hectare of agricultural land that was inherited to him by his parents.  Due to the great attention he is able to sell his products to the wholesalers that visit his plantation. He is in the full harvest of fruits that are already ripe in order to carry out an initial sale. 

Ever since he was a child he has loved music, so he has been playing piano at various cultural events for the past 15 years.  

He is a member of the communal bank named "Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo", meaning "A New Dawn of Guacamayo", and it is the first loan he has with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He is one of the youngest members of their group. Danyoon constantly attends to his harvest and although he doesn't have very much time, he plans on purchasing various sacks of organic fertilizer to spread throughout his citrus plantation.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 48 years old. She has three children who are between 13 and 25 years old. They are all in school.

Mediatrice owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of flour and other kinds of items. She is requesting a loan to buy different items for her shop and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 34 años, es madre soltera con una hija de 15 años. Es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo II.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 3000.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su tienda y botica.
Miriam, es de profesión enfermera antes trabajaba en una farmacia y también vendía ropas  para tener mas ingresos. Su hermana le comento que había una tienda en alquiler y decidió  tomarla y abrir una tienda de abarrotes en general y poco a poco lo fue surtiendo. Ahora vende plásticos, aguas, gaseosas, entre otros y como había trabajado en una farmacia también abrió una botica y le va bien.
Está en Finca Perú ya hace 3 años, le gusta por las capacitaciones y talleres, que recibe y lo pone en practica en su vida diaria.
Ahora está ahorrando para tener mas capital de trabajo.
Su sueño es poder construir su casa propia con un ambiente grande para su tienda.
texts.en:
Miriam is 34 years old and she is the single mother of a 15-year old girl. She is a member of the communal bank "Triunfo II". 

She requests a loan in the amount of S/. 3000

The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to supply her convenience store and drugstore. 

Miriam is a nurse by profession. She previously worked in a pharmacy and she also sold clothing to have another income. Her sister mentioned that she had a store to rent so she decided to take it and to open her own general store. She slowly added variety. Currently she sells plastic items, bottled drinks, soft drinks, and other merchandise. And as she once worked in a pharmacy she also opened a drugstore and it has been very successful. 

She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for 3 years and she likes it for the training provided and the workshops. She puts what she learns into practice in her daily life. 

She is saving money to have more working capital. 

Her dream is to be able to build a house of her own, ready with a large space for her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply her store and drugstore

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julian; es conviviente, el socio tiene 48 años de edad; y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 8, 6, y 1 mes de edad; el socio es maestro de obras y se dedica a trabajar en diferentes constructoras, el socio también alterna sus actividades con la crianza de animales menores, el socio cría pollos, corderos, el socio desea el préstamo ahora para poder mejorar su casa el socio invertirá en la compra de materiales para resanar las paredes de su fachada y de su baño. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para resanar su vivienda.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta” communal bank. This bank is located in the town of Rumichaca, in the province of Ururbamba, in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Julian. He lives with his partner, is 48 years old, and has 4 children who are 18, 8, and 6 years old, and one who is one month old. Julian is a master builder and he works for different construction companies. He also raises small animals, such as chickens and lambs. He needs the loan to make improvements to his house. He will buy materials to repair the walls of the front of the house and the bathroom. 

The member is very grateful for the loan and he promises to make his repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his house

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia D. is from the village of Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Patrocinia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing products in the local community. Patrocinia is just starting this business.
In 2007, Patrocinia joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Patrocinia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pillowcases, blankets and curtains for resale. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pillowcases, blankets and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Horonkantigui Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe HORONKANTIGUI, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à KAFELA  un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de charbon de bois à travers de NAWA. 
NAWA,compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100  sacs de charbon de bois. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins. Les sacs de charbon de bois sont revendus aux  marchés de SIKASSO et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA, qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The eight women of the Horonkantigui group are all married 35 year olds with an average of four children, and live in polygamous families in Kafela, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third largest region in Mali. 
They are on their fifteenth loan with Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' rising demand, and all of their previous loans have been successfully repaid. This group sells charcoal via one of their members, Nawa. She aims to use her loan to purchase 100 bags of charcoal. She sources her goods from the nearby villages and sells them from the markets in Sikasso and to her family. Her customer base is made up of men and women, and she takes cash sales. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to meet her family's everyday needs and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Elezabeth

texts.en:
Elezabeth is from the town of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 and married. Elezabeth has a business selling handicrafted items, such as items made from nipa palm leaves. Elezabeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Elezabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Elezabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials for manufacturing woven nipa. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elezabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase nipa palm for weaving

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 32 years old and makes gloves to financially support her family. She receives orders from different factories and shops and fulfills them to earn profits. She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transport services to passengers. Robina is the mother of two daughters and a son. Her daughters are students, while her son is only 2 years old and has not started his education yet. 

Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her glove-making business. With the loan, she will buy a glove-making machine that will help her finish her orders on time and earn her better profit. She started her business a couple of years ago, and it is doing well for her. She hopes that after the loan investment she will be able to improve it further. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.  

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: to buy a  glove-making machine.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Vilma is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruits for her fruit vending business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.en: Gricelda is 37 years old and a single mother to her daughter, who is seven years old. Gricelda's occupation is selling nutritional products, which she has been doing for over seven years. She sells all types of vitamins and other nutrient-rich products. Gricelda is asking for a loan to pay for her daughter's education. Her daughter still has a lot of schooling left and Gricelda wants to make sure that she receives the best possible education and opportunities. Gricelda is a responsible woman and is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
El señor Benjamín esta agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo comprar la herramienta que necesitaba. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar una maquina donde le pueda el detectar el problema que traen los carro que le llevan para reparar y así poder arreglarlos mas rápido y así sus clientes estén mas satisfechos por su buen trabajo, y los recomiendan a su familiares y amistades. 
Planea pagar el con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de mecánica automotriz  
Don Benjamín espero contar con su cooperación para este crédito y poder comprar el equipo que a su negocio le está haciendo falta.
texts.en:
Benjamin is grateful for the cooperation in his previous loan, in which he could buy the tool that he needed.  He is now requesting a loan to buy a machine that allows him to detect the problem in the cars brought to him to repair so he can fix them faster.  His clients will be more satisfied with his good work, and recommend him to their friends and family.

Benjamin plans to pay back the loan with the profits he gets from his auto mechanic business. He looks forward to your cooperation for this loan to purchase equipment that he is missing in his business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools for his business.

loans.name: Colonia Libertad Group

texts.en: The Colonia Libertad Solidarity Group includes Maria, Daysi, and Lesly, all of whom reside in Choluteca, Honduras.  Maria, the group leader, is a single mother of two children.  For the last ten years, she has made a living by making and selling bread out of her home.  Maria is very hard working and receives help from her mother to run the small business.  Maria is requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 to purchase ingredients to make bread. Daysi is requesting HNL 8,000.00 and Lesly is requesting HNL 5,000.00 to buy products for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make bread that she sells from her home.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en:
Jean Batiste is a father of two children. He is a rice farmer and has been doing rice farming for the past 10 years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.
