Mario sells videos and movies on CD. He has also been selling firewood and coal for nine years, a business he started with his own savings and later with loans from Afodenic. He has obtained five loans from this institution, with very beneficial results for his family.

He is 35 and lives in Villa Reconciliación. He and his wife have 2 children, aged 4 and 6.

He will use the loan to buy firewood and coal, as well as many movies to offer his customers a variety.

He plans to buy a plot of land in Ciudad de Rivas because he travels there to sell movies for days at a time.

He would like to buy land so as to have a permanent store, the aim being to improve his earnings and give his children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy movie CDs, firewood and coal

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia
Catalina es casada tiene 48 años, dos hijos de 28 y 16 años este ultimo esta estudiando  en la escuela estatal. 
Catalina se dedica a ayudar a coser a su hermana y  a la decoración de fiestas infantiles por necesidad. 
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de tela para mandiles de colegio.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió la solidaridad, a  como crecer en el negocio.  
El sueño de catalina  es tener una tienda  bazar.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Sarita Colonia Community Bank. Catalina is married and has two children aged 28 and 16 - the youngest is studying at the state school. Catalina helps her sister with sewing and providing decorations for children's parties on order. She needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy material to make school aprons. Since she's been with Finca, she has learnt about solidarity and how to make her business grow. Catalina's dream is to own a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Catalina needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy material to make school aprons

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca A. is married with three children who are currently in school. She is 34 years old. To raise money to support her children in school, she sells foods like fried yam, cooked beans and fried plantain. Fried yams are enjoyed with hot pepper with fish and a lot of Ghanaians enjoy it so much.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of beans, plantains, yam, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children’s education. She is a member of a community group called Mawulawe (meaning God is will do it) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To  buy more bags of beans, plantains, yam, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto tiene 59 años, es un padre muy abnegado, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa, quien es la madre de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales, todos viven fuera; pero ahora están a cargo de sus nietas, hijas de su hija mayor, quien se fue, dejándolas en su casa. Cuando sus hijos eran pequeños Modesto tenía una bodega muy bien surtida, debido al amor que le tenía a su hija mayor, la dejó a cargo de la administración de este negocio, pero ella no supo valorar la confianza depositada, despilfarrado el dinero y llevando a la quiebra la bodega. Desde entonces, Modesto comenzó a vender condimentos molidos y verduras, mientras que su esposa cocina para los comensales a quienes les vende el almuerzo diariamente, donde Modesto es el encargado de la atención. También tiene algunos cultivos a los que se dedica por las tardes, pero lo que más le gusta es el comercio, ya que durante su vida de negociante acumuló muy buenas ganancias. Por ello, trabaja con mucho empeño brindando un buen trato a sus clientes, tanto a los que le compran verduras, como a los comensales de su esposa, de quienes depende su progreso, nos dice. Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, durante los dos periodos concluidos demostró responsabilidad en cada uno de sus pagos, del mismo modo, se compromete a seguir cumpliendo así. Cabe resaltar que Modesto es un hombre muy noble, de buen carácter y generoso, en cada reunión de su banco comunal siempre suele estar de sueño, de lo cual todos sus compañeros le bromean y él nunca demuestra enojo. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar su mercadería, con ello piensa comprar más productos comestibles de primera necesidad, para sacar a flote nuevamente su bodega.
texts.en:
Modesto is 59 years old, a very unselfish father, and lives in his own house with his wife, who is the mother of his five children, all of whom live outside the house. However, they are take care of his granddaughters, the children of their oldest daughter, who has left them. When their children were young, Modesto had a successful shop. Because of his love for his oldest daughter, he left her in charge of managing the shop. However, she did not know the value of the confidence he instilled in her and she squandered the money and drove the shop into bankruptcy. Subsequently, Modesto began selling powdered spices and vegetables. His wife cooks for diners whom they sell lunch to daily and Modesto is in charge of taking care of their customers. He also does some farming in the afternoons. However, what he is most interested in is running a business, since during his life as a business man he has been able to make a good living. He works very hard and treats his clients well, so much so that they have told us about it. This is his third loan with MFP. During his previous loans he has demonstrated responsibility and been on time with each of his payments. They highlight that Modesto is a very noble man of good character and is generous. At each of the community bank meetings he always appears to be asleep and his friends joke around with him but never gets upset. The money from the loan will be used to increase his inventory. He will be able to purchase more foodstuffs and will be able to make his business profitable once again.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Samina Muhammad Arshad Group

texts.en:
Farzana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Bushra baji and Sadia parveen baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy garments to sell.

Samina baji is a wife of M. A. and has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Samina baji is a very hard-working woman. She cares her family more than herself. She prepares embroidered dresses, which she sells to clothing shops to earn income. She saves her money in a committee and plans to utilize it in her husband’s business when she gets the right amount. Her husband has run a grocery shop in the community for the past 2 years, and Samina baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Salama Martine

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, les pluies intensives de ces derniers jours ont détruit une grande partie de son stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et demande alors à WAGES un crédit pour acheter 21 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns an income from commerce in charcoal. The intense rains of recent days have destroyed a large portion of her stock. She wants to stock up again and is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy 21 sacks of charcoal and to cover the cost of transport. She supplies herself from inland locations. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty I. is a fashion designer and she also sells sarongs. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Исакова Дилбар проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает в строительной компании  в районе Ура-Тюбе. Сама клиентка имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует национальными лепешками. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборта.
texts.en:
I. Dilbar is 37 lives in Rumi District with her husband and three children. Her husband works for a construction company in Ura-Tube. For the past five years I. has been in business selling traditional flatbreads from her shop at the market. She plans to use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis M. is 29 and a married father of two children, aged nine and seven. He lives with his family in Shimanzi town in the coast province of Kenya, and he has been in the business of selling 'Tiens' products for the last five years. He also offers taxi service in the evening as a way to supplement his income.

Francis has good marketing skills through word of mouth and has been able to build a large network of 'Tiens' products and thus earns a lot of commission.

He came to learn about KADET through a friend who is a client and this will mark his first time borrowing. He plans to purchase 'Tiens' products and also use some money for transport to market his products.

He has a drive to expand and diversify his business and in future hopes to own a pharmacy.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase 'Tiens' products and for transport to market the products

loans.name: Catalina Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos y estudio educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en Capana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de papa, chuño, quinua, ocas, etc. Para la venta en la feria semanal.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the “San Salvador Luminoso” communal bank that is located in the Capachica district, Puno province, in the state of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She studied until the 3rd year of primary school and lives in Capana. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years. Her initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles was used for the purchase of products of the region. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 600 Nuevos Soles, which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes, chuño (freeze dried potatoes), quinoa, oca, etc. to sell in the weekly market. Her biggest desire is to continue working to be able to educate her children. She likes to save and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, chuño (freeze dried potatoes), quinoa, oca, etc.

loans.name: Magbereh Group

texts.en:
Here are Idrissa F., Kadiatu C. and Adama K.. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Magbereh, named after the home village of the group’s leader. For the very first time, they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each from Kiva Lenders, through SMT. This loan will certainly create significant impacts into the businesses and personal lives of these borrowers. With the profit made out of this loan, they will be able to repay their loan on time and in full, feed their children, send them to school and pay medical bills. 

Idrissa F. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. He is now age thirty-eight, married to a businesswoman and they have five children. One of his children is now in secondary school and others are still in primary schools. Idrissa was born in a village call Magbereh, about four miles from Magburaka town. Idrissa sells dried fish and has been in this business for many years. He will invest this loan into his business.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Ehizonomen

texts.en: G. is 34 years old and single. He sells fish which he buys in cartons from cold rooms. He buys them from Benin Lagos and Port Harcourt. He is requesting for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more cartons of fish to sell. He thanks you for the loans

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials necessary for their businesses

loans.name: Anna Grace

texts.en:
Anna Grace D. is a 30-year-old mother who lives in a village located at Barangay Bangar, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband is Mr. Romar D. and they are gifted with two children named Russel D. and Raven D.. Being a parent, they are so concerned with the future of their children. Hence, they sacrifice their time and endure hardships and difficulties to earn a living and support the education of their children. 
Her husband works as a security guard in a Globe cell site located in their village while Anna Grace is engaged in selling frozen foods like hotdogs, tocino, chicken meat and fish. She acquires her products from Solano Public Market and sells them to their village. Through her patience and sacrifices, she can earn a net income of PHP1,000 per month, which she uses to acquire their daily basic needs and finance the schooling of their children. She wants to sell more frozen foods but she has a small amount of capital. In this regard, she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000 to be used in acquiring additional items to sell. She is so happy with this financial assistance because she is able to improve her small business. She hopes that someday she can improve their status of living and give their children a better future.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn C., 29, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business selling cosmetic products and providing public phone service, earning collectively an income of US $5 per day. Her husband always helps his wife in the business. He is also a public local primary school teacher, earning an income of US $1.9 to help cover the family expenses. C. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US $700 to build a bigger shop and buy more prepaid mobile cards for resale.

loans.use: To build a bigger shop and buy prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer and is a hardworking woman. She plants plantain, cassava and pineapple on her farm. Her greatest joy in her farming business is during the harvest when her crops are sold. Her husband is a mechanic.

Alice is 46 years old. She has three children and her youngest child is 12 years old.

Alice hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant on her farm. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 53 years old, married and has four children. She is a committed LAPO client. She sells kerosene. She has been in business for close to six years and is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase kerosene in bulk at a reduced price, thereby increasing her profit and, she hopes, meeting customers' demand. With this business, she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education. She says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 58 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia, junto a sus dos hijos, y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
En su pequeño puesto de periódicos Lucia pasa sus días, ella tiene su puesto en una de las plazas principales de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde con mucha amabilidad y carisma atiende a todas las personas que asisten a su puesto a informarse y a comprarle un periódico.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuál es el periódico que tiene las mejores noticias, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto. 
Para más adelante, espera juntar el dinero necesario para implementar una bodega.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lucia con MFP y espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar su puesto, ya que por el paso del tiempo su infraestructura se esta deteriorando.
texts.en:
Lucia, 58, is a very hard-working and happy woman. She lives in her own house with her two children. What she wants most is to succeed in life. Lucia spends her days in a small newspaper stand. She has her stand in one of the main plazas in the city of Juliaca. With much friendliness and charisma she waits on the people who go to her stand to inform themselves and buy a newspaper. What she likes most about her work is advising her customers about which newspaper has the best news. She has been doing this for 20 years. The most difficult part is having to stay at her stand all day. Later, she hopes to get together enough money to set up a convenience store. This is Lucia’s first loan with MFP. She expects to be punctual with her payments because she does not want to harm the other members of her communal bank. She is much loved and respected in her communal bank. The l,000 PEN she is requesting is to improve her stand because the infrastructure has deteriorated with the passage of time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her stand

loans.name: Urandelger

texts.en:
Urandelger is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a traditional, Mongolian, nomadic tent called a “ger”. His two oldest daughters are 15 and attend the local secondary school. The youngest is not yet of school age. 
Urandelger operates a clothing business from a rented stall at a local market. He started his business in 2003 and has established himself well in the local business community. At first his working capital was 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD). Through his hard work he has increased his working capital to more than 2,500,000 tugrugs (~1800 USD). 
Urandelger has many plans for the future and is working diligently to expand and improve his business. He says, "my goal for the future is to provide quality products and grow my customer base". He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase children's clothes from China to sell in his business.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothes

loans.name: Angel Ramon Ayala

texts.en: Angel Ramon Ayala Ganoa is from San Estanislao and lives in the Tacuara neighborhood.  He is 38 years-old and married to Marele Enriqueta Vergara Portillo, who is 33 years-old.  They have one child together.  Angel owns a bakery which he operates out of his home.  He has an established client base and earns a good income.  Angel has good personal and professional references and is a hard worker.  He would like to build a larger room to house his bakery.

loans.use: To build a larger bakery.

loans.name: Félix Benjamín

texts.es:
El señor Benjamín P. es trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace un año, donde se desempeña como colector de impuestos, es soltero. Anteriormente trabajaba como mesero en el restaurante El Doctor donde laboro por 5 años.
Benjamín nos expresa que los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido de gran ayuda porque le han permitido hacer mejoras y este ultimo que se le otorgo para gastos médicos (exámenes médicos, compra de medicina) y otros gastos que solventar.
texts.en:
Benjamín P. has been employed by Chichigalpa's City Hall for a year. He is a tax collector. He's single. He used to work as a waiter at El Doctor restaurant; he was there for five years. Benjamín tells us that the loans he has gotten have been very useful beccause they made it possible for him to do some improvements. This most recent loan will be for medical expenses (medical exams and purchase of medicine) and for some other expenses that need to be paid.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for personal expenses, medical expenses and some other expenses that need to be paid.

loans.name: Fernando Obdulio

texts.es:
Don Fernando Obdulio M. M., vive en una comunidad que se encuentra ubicada en el municipio de yali donde él se dedica a la actividad de trabajos agrícolas  específicamente al cultivo de café y a la ganadería. El crédito lo utilizara para darle asistencia técnica a su finca de café, en este periodo el necesita darle mantenimiento como es regulación de sombra, limpia y asistencia con insumos el va a comprar 12 quintales de abono y 12 quintales de urea y pago de mano de obra para la aplicación de los insumos.
Este cliente vive en una zona altamente productiva y por la característica de la zona que tiene una altura de 1000 msnm (mil metros sobre el nivel del mar) es apta para el cultivo de café que es la actividad principal de trabajo de este cliente, este productor comenzó su trabajo ayudándole a sus padres desde que el era pequeño y después le dieron como herencia 4 manzanas de café. Don Fernando con el crédito el espera darle la asistencia que necesita su finca o cultivo de café debido a que acaba de sacar la cosecha y en este periodo comienza a darle mantenimiento para garantizar la cosecha del próximo año ya que este tipo de cultivo da la cosecha una vez cada año, con esto el obtendrá mayores rendimientos y un producto de mejor calidad el cual le beneficiara a él a la hora de la cosecha, tomado en cuenta que este es un rubro de bastante importancia y uno de los principales  rubros de exportación en nuestro país.
Don Fernando Obdulio es casado y tiene 2 hijos la esposa le ayuda a los quehaceres de la casa y cuido de sus hijos él tiene una niña y un varoncito, el varón está estudiando la primaria y la niña no tiene edad todavía para la escuela.
Don Fernando tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y se le han otorgado 4 créditos para estas actividades de trabajo.
El impacto que obtiene este cliente es bastante importante ya que con este apoyo el podrá garantizar y asistir a sus cultivos obteniendo mayores rendimientos y un producto con mejor calidad, esto le beneficiara y mejora sus ingresos permitiéndole ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando Obdulio M. M. lives in a community, which is located in the Yali municipality. He does agricultural work. Specifically, he grows coffee and raises livestock. The loan will be used to give his coffee farm technical assistance. At this time he needs to perform maintenance like regulating the shade, cleaning, and providing care with supplies. He will buy 12 “quintales” (a quintal is 100 pounds) of fertilizer, 12 quintales of urea, and pay for the labor to apply the supplies. He lives in an area that is highly productive. The area is 1,000 meters above sea level and is suitable for growing coffee, which is his primary work. This producer started his work by helping his parents when he was young. Later they gave him four “manzanas” (a little over 3 acres) of coffee. Fernando will use the loan to give the necessary help to his farm or coffee crops. He just finished the harvest, and during this time he starts performing maintenance to guarantee the harvest for next year. This type of crop is harvested once a year. This way he will get greater performance and a better quality product. That will benefit him at harvest time. Keep in mind that this is a very important field, and it is one of the main products exported from our country. Fernando Obdulio is married and has two children. His wife helps with the household chores and takes care of their children. He has a daughter and a son. His son is in primary school, and his daughter is not yet old enough for school. Fernando has worked with Ceprodel for three years. He has received four loan for his work activities. The impact of what this client obtains is very important. With this help he will be able to guarantee and help his crops with greater production of a better quality product. This will benefit him and improve his income. That will allow him to give his family a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 12 “quintales” (a quintal is 100 pounds) of fertilizer, 12 quintales of urea, and pay for the labor to apply the supplies to help his farm

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta H. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years-old and married with four school-aged children. Julieta owns and operates a sari-sari (general) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Julieta joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Thành's Group

texts.en:
"Thành N. Thị (208023) is a 48 year-old female living in the town Hoang Hoa Thanh Hoá.  Thành is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Hoằng Hoá (02.08.05).

Thành is married and has four school-aged children.  To making a living, Thành operates a family member's business venture raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Thành has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2003, Thành joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thành has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,761,200 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the 9th loan taken out by her from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thành plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Tâm (25) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  B. Thị Thoa (26) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 3,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising crops.

3.  C. Thị Thanh (33) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  N. Thị Lý (32) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Thành N. Thị (208023) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở Hoằng Hoá Thanh Hoá.  Thành là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Hoằng Hoá (02.08.05).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Thành thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thành kiếm được khoảng 1000000 VND.  Vào 2003, Thành đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thành đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,761,200 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thị Tâm (25) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  B. Thị Thoa (26) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.

3.  C. Thị Thanh (33) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. Thị Lý (32) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock.

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en:
Nicat M. was born in 1975, and is married and has 2 children. He lives with his family in Baku city. 

Nicat has been in the glassware business for 6 years. He is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Rosado Karina

texts.es:
Karina de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, hace ocho años atrás invirtió sus ahorros en una cabina telefónicas en su casa, para prestarle el servicio a sus vecinos, con los ingresos poco a poco incremento su negocio. 

Karina a hecho un pequeño Cyber en su casa y ha ubicado las cabinas conjuntamente para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. También vende chip para teléfonos, y recargas para teléfonos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar dos computadoras para su Cyber, una de sus metas es tener una linea de Cyber en todo Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Karina is 39 years old and lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil. Eight years ago, she used her savings to install telephone booths in her house so that she could provide calling services to her neighbors. With her earnings, she was able to gradually increase her business.

Karina has also established a small cybercafé in her home next to the phone booths so that she could provide better service to her customers. She also sells single use and rechargeable calling cards. With her loan, Karina wants to buy two computers for her cybercafé. One of her goals is to have a chain of cybercafés throughout Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two computers

loans.name: Khob

texts.en: Mrs. Khob Y. is a 40-year-old villager who lives in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chang Chom (pictured with her), are farmers who own 2.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Khob Y. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. In addition to farming, Mr. Chang Chom is also a duck breeder for duck eggs, from which he can earn a small income to support his family. The couple has three children, who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Kimchour

texts.en: Mrs. Kimchour C. (in the photo) is 43 years old. She lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two daughters who are waitresses in a restaurant in Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a disabled person. Kimchour has been selling fish in her village for ten years. Her two daughters commute to work in Phnom Penh with their own motorbike, but the motorbike is old and breaks very often. Hence, Kimchour is applying for her first loan in the amount of $500 to buy a new motorcycle for her daughters to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her daughters to drive to work

loans.name: Silvia Jeannette

texts.es: Silvia Jeannette A. V. de 27 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, una de las ciudades con mayor comercio del país, la cual esta ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 5 años de edad, el cual asiste al kinder. Silvia se dedica a la venta de huevos por mayor, la cual comercializa con personas que tiene ventas dentro del mercado de San Martín, así mismo Silvia se coloca en el parqueo de este mercado, en donde vende por unidades los huevos. Desde hace 2 años que ella se dedica a este oficio el cual ha sido de mucho beneficio para su familia, debido a que puede brindarle una ayuda económica a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Silvia solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de huevos,  ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual espera poder mejorar aún más sus ventas y de esta forma darle una mejor vida a su pequeño hijo, así mismo desea poder comprar algunos repuestos a su automóvil, ya que es este su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Silvia Jeannette A. V., 27, resides in Soyapango, one of the cities with the highest levels of commercial activity in the country, which is located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and five-year-old son who attends kindergarten. Silvia earns a living selling eggs wholesale to persons who have stalls in the San Martín market, and also stations herself the parking lot of the same market and sells her eggs individually. She has worked in this line of business for two years which has been of great benefit to her family, since she is able to make an economic contribution to her husband for help with all the household expenses. Silvia seeks a loan in order to purchase a greater number of eggs. She is a very responsible and hardworking person who hopes to improve her sales even more and thus give a better life to her young son. She would also like to buy some replacement parts for her automobile given that it is something she uses in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase eggs wholesale

loans.name: Jesús Andres

texts.es:
Jesús Andres P. E., tiene 19 años.  Es soltero,  vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijo. 

Jesús es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jesús  se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa.  Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la competencia de la localidad.

Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jesús Andres P. E. is 19 years old. He is single and lives in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has no children. Jesús is a member of the rural bank “Y”, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. This is the first loan they have taken out with the San José Cooperative. Jesús works selling clothes. He makes the purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo and sells them in a locale in the house he lives in. He is asking for a loan to invest in purchasing clothes to grow his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have his own stable business to improve his quality of life. His challenges are the lack of money and the competition in the area. He likes sports and working in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in purchasing clothes to grow his business

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
FRANCISCO JOSE R. R., Trabaja Colector  de Ruta en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua. el prestamo lo Va a utilizarlo en su mejora de su casa de habitación y algunos gastos personales.
es padre de familia de tres hijos dos se encuentran estudiando.
el dice que toda la plata que va trabajar  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, y solventar algunos gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Francisco Jose R. R. is a toll collector at the Wholesale Market of Managua. This loan will be used to make improvements to his home and pay for some personal expenses. Francisco is the father of three children, two of whom are in school.

He says that all the money that he received by partnering with CEPRODEL has been used for home improvements and a few family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements & personal expenses

loans.name: La Bendicion De Suchi Group

texts.es: La señora Rebeca Melchora Ramírez Q., cuenta con 34 años de edad y tiene dos hijos estudiando, solo ha cursado el sexto grado de primaria, más sin embargo día a día se ha esforzado para poder sufragar sus gastos personales ya que su esposo ha fallecido desde hace 10 años, anteriormente, aproximadamente hace 5 años atrás ella se dedicaba como empleada de una panadería en su comunidad en la cual 2 años después implemento su propia panadería ya que era la única manera de sobresalir con sus hijos, al igual que ella  y cuatro vecinas mas de la comunidad tienen la visión y el objetivo de seguir creando sus propios negocios por tal razón formaron un grupo de mujeres la cual se les denomina grupo de mujeres la bendición de Suchi para solicitar a la Asociación ASDIR un préstamo como apoyo para logar sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rebeca Melchora R. Q., 34, has two children, both in school. She herself only finished the sixth grade. Her husband died 10 years ago and she has had to work hard, day in and day out, to pay the family's expenses. She started working, 5 years ago, in a bakery shop in her town and later, after 2 years there, set up her own shop because it was the only way that she could help her children get ahead in the world. Like her, four other neighbors have had the vision and the drive to create their own businesss and they set up the La Bendicion de Suchi community bank to apply to the Asociacion ASDIR for a loan to meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: José Alfonso

texts.es: José Alfonso H. O. de 43 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, así mismo vive junto a sus hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad, dos jóvenes los cuales debido a la situación económica se han visto obligados a interrumpir sus estudios, por lo que le ayudan a José en el negocio y a su madre con los oficios del hogar. José posee un molino, en el cual brinda sus servicios a sus vecinos y personas que residen en los alrededores de su hogar en donde esta ubicado el negocio. El molino trabaja con energía eléctrica, lo cual es una desventaja para José ya que en el cantón que él vive las personas sufren de varios cortes eléctricos día con día, por lo que muchas veces él no puede atender a sus clientes, lo cual se traduce en pérdidas tanto para toda su familia como para José, los cuales dependen por completo de este trabajo. Es por esta razón que José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de un nuevo molino con un motor que trabaje con diesel, lo cual le permitirá trabajar incluso si no hay energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
José Alfonso H. O., who is 43 years old, lives in San Juan Opico, La Libertad Department. He lives with his wife, who takes care of their home, and their two children, aged 17 and 15 years old. Due to their financial situation, the two teens have had to interrupt their studies to help José with the business and their mother with the housework. José owns a mill. He offers milling service to his neighbors and people who lives in the areas surrounding his home, which where his business is located. His mill works on electricity, which is a disadvantage for José. In the canton where he lives, the people suffer from various power outages each day. Because of this, he is often unable to offer his services to his customers, which translates into losses for José as well as for his entire family, who are completely dependent on his business. This is why José is requesting the loan. With the loan, he'll be able to invest in the purchase of a new mill with a diesel motor, which will allow him to work even when the power is out.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor for a mill.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda P. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Luzviminda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 40,000 every harvesting season.

In 2009, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Las Colmena 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Lourdes es una D. los miembros del Grupo Las Colmena  1, 2 y 3, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos misceláneos, zapatos, artesanía,  etc.  Sus plazas se encuentran en L. ciudad D. Samana, una ciudad turística en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Océano atlántico y rica en recursos naturales.  Está asociada D. Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque le interesaba obtener un capital para fines D. negocio, y D. esta manera hay mas compromiso y crecimiento. Tiene 2 hijos, los cuales viven junto con elL. y su padre, realiza como negocio, las ventas ambulante D. productos D. belleza y cosmeticos. Lourdes desea terminar sus estudios universitarios, el cual es su mayor reto, y mientras lo logra seguira asistiendo a L. iglesia, L. cual es su lugar favorito.

Lourdes  está muy emocionada D. recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después D. haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento D. su negocio. ElL. ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 1 año, el cual lo inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en L. compra D. diferentes productos D. uso personal como cosmeticos, y D. belleza.  ElL. va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio, desea construir su casa y lo hara por medio del ahorro D. los beneficios que genere su negocio a largo plazo. Su sueño es servir siempre al Señor por sobre todas las cosas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of Grupo Las Colmena 1, 2 and 3.  The group’s members are micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, artisanry, etc.  Their markets are in Samana, a developing tourist destination, bordered by the Atlantic coasts and rich in natural resources.  Lourdes, a member of Esperanza International, became part of Grupo Las Colmena because she was interested in obtaining capital for her business, and this way there is more commitment and growth.  She is married and has two children who live with her.  She is a travelling saleswoman, selling beauty products and cosmetics.  Lourdes wants to finish her college education—it’s her biggest challenge—while she continues to help at the church, which is her favorite place.

Lourdes is very excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza International, having satisfactorily paid back her first and being given the opportunity to grow her business.  She has had her business for about one year, having started it with the first loan she received from Esperanza.  She will invest her new loan in the purchase of different personal products like cosmetics and other beauty products.  She will reinvest her earnings into her business.  She wants to build a house, and she will do it by saving up money maD. from her business in the long term.  Her dream is to always serve God above all else.

loans.use: Cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Odom

texts.en:
Mr. Odom R. (in the photo) is 34 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokny Say is 31 years old; they have been married since 1997 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 25 kilometers away.

Odom is an ice deliveryman. He buys ice and then delivers it to customers who have businesses that require ice, such as people who sell cold drinks or noodles. His wife assists her husband in the business.  

Odom is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to expand his business by purchasing additional ice for resale.

loans.use: To expand his ice delivery business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A. is from the town of Tinago, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental Philippines. She is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products like fried chicken in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

* Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma R.'s main source of income comes from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. She is 22 years old, married and has one small child. Her husband is the driver. They are from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. Alma has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for motorcycle maintenance. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 23 years old. She is married and has two children who are two and five years old. She works together with her husband in the business. Alphonsine owns a boutique and bar. She has had this business for a period of five years. 

She needs this loan to add more merchandise like lotions, cooking oil and battery cells in her business and she hopes to buy a plot of land and care for her family from the profit she makes. In the future, she would like to have a big retail shop.

loans.use: To add more merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and to expand his business

loans.name: Yenis Lorenis

texts.es:
Yenis de 42 años, empezó hace aproximadamente 15 años atrás a vender comida a sus diferentes conocidos y vecinos. Como tenia trayectoria cocinando y los clientes que al comienzo de su negocio tuvo estaban muy satisfecho ella continuo con su negocio. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana continúo con su negocio de venta de comida trabajando desde las 09h00am que comienza a hacer la comida hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. Uno de los inconvenientes que tuvo  hace años fue con su salud pero ella continuo trabajando para poder mantener a su hijo ya que es madre soltera. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere construir mejor su vivienda ya que es ahí donde hace la comida y atiende a sus clientes por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, pintura. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y mejorar el espacio de atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yenis, 42, began selling food about 15 years ago to her neighbors and acquaintances. The customers that she had at the beginning were very satisfied so she continued her business selling food.  

Living in a semi-urban area, she has kept up her business selling food.  She works from 9:00am, when she starts to cook, until 4:00pm every day. Years ago, her health became a challenge, but she continued working in order to take care of her son, since she is a single mother.

She has many aspirations for her business and for that reason would like to improve her home, since that is where she makes the food and serves her customers.  She would like to use the loan to buy cement, cinder blocks and paint.  In the future, she would like to improve the construction of her house and the space where she serves her customers.

loans.use: Cement, paint and cinder blocks

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while the others already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food stall business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she owns a real-estate agency that contributes to her other source of income. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, the business is very low. She hopes to establish a hardware shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of beans, rice and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu because it has no legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase stock of beans, rice and wheat flour

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín vive en la casa alquilada de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de equipos modernos ya que el señor presta el servicio de amplificación para eventos sociales. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Benjamín es soltero.
 
Es el octavo crédito con Impro, y su historial de pagos es impecable.
texts.en:
Benjamín lives in a house rented from his parents located in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy modern equipment for the DJ service that he provides for social events. This is Benjamín’s sole source of income. He is single.

This is his eighth loan with Kiva partner Impro, and his history of making repayments is impeccable.

loans.use: to buy modern equipment for his DJ business

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Âgé de plus de  33 ans, Monsieur  Dramane K. est marié et père de 3 enfants (1 garçon et 2 filles), il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Dramane K.  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initié, il y a environ quatre ans, à cette activité d’achat et de vente de bazins blancs, soude caustique, teintures, etc. Il mène son activité à Wayerma I en face de l’Agence Malienne pour la Presse et la Publicité (AMAP) de Sikasso, non loin de la prison centrale où il dispose d’une boutique. Monsieur K. est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  il y a trois ans et avec qui  il est à son quatrième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
Ce  nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 25 paquets de soude caustique, 15 pièces de bazin, 10 sacs de potasse, 15 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetées à Bamako pour  ensuite être revendues à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes teinturières de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce présent prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane K. is over 33 years old and married with three children (a boy and two girls). He lives with his wife and their children in a large traditional family in Wayerma I, a popular district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having attempted many occupations without success, Dramane K. leaned the business of buying and selling white damask, caustic soda, dyes, etc. approximately four years ago. He conducts his business in Wayerma I in front of the Malian Press and Publicity Agency of Sikasso, not far from the central prison where he has a shop. Mr. K.'s products are in high demand due to their high quality.

In order to better serve an increasing customer base, he decided three years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with whom he is now on his fourth individual loan. Previous loans have all been repaid in full. 

This new loan will allow him to buy 25 packets of caustic soda, 15 pieces of damask, 10 bags of potash, 15 boxes of dye in different colors, etc.  He buys his stocks in Bamako and sells the merchandise to a clientele composed mainly of women dyers from Sikasso.

With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 250,000 FCFA which will be used primarily to increase his working capital, help with the family expenses. and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: To buy white damask, caustic soda, dyes, potash, etc.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Ana Alicia R.: se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace un años y tiene un local en el mercado local de su cominidad ella nos cuenta que nececita su refinanciamiento para invertir en compra de  mas frutas especial mente en la compra de mangos,por el tiempo ya que ella esta fruta lo hace de diferentes maneras como mango con miel,etc su deceo ahora es poder vender mas variedad de frutas, y sacar adelante a su hija como tambien ella misma.
texts.en: Ana Alicia R. has been selling fruits for a few years.  She has a stand at the local market in her community.  Ana says that she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of more fruits, especially mangoes.  At the moment, she is preparing the fruit in different ways, such as serving mango with honey.  Now she wants to sell a greater variety of fruits so that she and her daughter can move forward.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Deyanira Del Socorro

texts.es: Deyanira, de 45 años reside en el municipio de Corinto, su negocio es una pulpería, tiene cuatro hijos pero solamente 2 están a su cargo. El negocio lo tiene hace dos años, lo administra todos los días pues tiene la responsabilidad de ofrecerles a sus hijos el pan de cada día todos los días. Todos los días abre su local, con en donde la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos diarios. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para surtir la tienda, comprando productos de uso domestico, como granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, jugos, refrescos y pan que son  productos muy necesarios en cada hogar y de calidad. Para Deyanira su aspiración es que el negocio sea fuerte y estable en las ventas, que los ingresos mejoren y dar un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Deyanira is 45 years old and lives in the town of Corinto.  Her business is a grocery store that she has owned for two years.  Deyanira has four children but only two of them are in her care.  She runs her business every day since she is responsible for offering her children their daily bread every day.  She opens her store every day and most of her customers come to buy different products every day.

Deyanira is currently requesting a loan to stock her store.  She will buy household essentials such as basic grains, soap, detergents, juice, soft drinks and bread as these are quality products that are essential in every household.  Deyanira's aspirations are for her business to be strong and stable in terms of sales, for her income to improve and for her family to enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soap, detergents, juice, soft drinks and bread which are essential in every household

loans.name: Ingrid Alexandra

texts.es:
La señora Ingrid Alexandra Martínez es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 32 años de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado desde hace 9 años aproximadamente.
Martínez invertirá el crédito en  mercadería para la temporada de verano como chinelas, trajes de baño, shores, sandalias, vestidos de verano…etc. y su sueño es lograr tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ingrid Alexandra Martínez, 32, is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman.  She’s been selling clothes and shoes for the last 9 years approximately.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise for the summer season like: slippers, bathing suits, shorts, sandals, summer dresses, etc.  Her dream is to manage to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta  se dedica al  comercio en la venta de ropa usada, y una pequeña pulpería, que inicio, con ahorros propios, y que ha venido a reforzar con préstamos que Afodenic ha otorgado en tres ciclos. 
La mercadería la  compra en el mercado oriental a los proveedores,  para lograr precios favorables y así poder vender a mejor precios a sus clientes. Siempre con el anhelo de poder apoyar  a sus tres hijos, que junto con su esposo trabajan para el bienestar de su futuro.
Marta comprara con este nuevo préstamo  dos pacas mixtas de ropa usada, para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta sells used clothing and has a small grocery store that she started with her own savings and has reinforced with loans from Afodenic during three lending cycles. She buys her merchandise in the bazaar from the wholesalers, to get more favorable prices and therefore be able to sell to her customers at better prices. 

She has always wanted to be able to support her three children, who together with her husband work for the well-being of their future.

Marta will use this new loan to buy two mixed bundles of used clothing to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy two mixed bundles of used clothing to sell more in the summer

loans.name: Nonvignon Vedoko Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON VEDOKO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier  à Vêdoko à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin). La présidente du groupe, Laure (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo), est née en 1977 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Laure est mariée à un hôtelier du nom de Hlouédé. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Il y a près de quatre ans que Laure vit au quartier Vêdoko avec sa famille. Laure est allée à l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire, puis a appris la couture. C’est cette activité que Laure exerce depuis trois ans et qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille et de satisfaire ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Laure vend de la farine de manioc, du sucre et des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Laure achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Laure sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en: NONVIGNON VEDOKO is a group of 3 people who all live in Vêdoko, a neighborhood of Cotonou (economic capital of Bénin). The president of the group, Laure (whom you can see raising her hand on the picture), was born in 1977 in Ouidah, a historical city of Bénin. Laure is married to a hotelier named Hlouédé. They have 3 children who all go to school. Two of them live with them. Laure has been living in the Vêdoko nieghborhood with her family for about 4 years. She went to school up to the secondary level and then went on to learn sewing. With the job she has had for 3 years, Laure has been able to feed and cater to her family. On the side, Laure also sells cassava, sugar, and sewing supplies in her workshop. She buys those items from Dantokpa, an international market in Bénin. This is the second time that Laure is asking for a loan from ALIDé. It will enable her to strengthen her business and to better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He is a relatively new business owner; he started working as a construction worker almost three years ago.  His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. Despite his situation, he feels positive about his business potentiA. for the coming year because during those three years, he has been able to build a good business reputation. He is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools needed for his work. In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is 50 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Mahmud's goals are to grow in his personal life and develop his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with life to get ahead and fulfill his goals.

Mahmud is a taxi driver who travels through the streets of Istaravshan, Tajikistan, in search of customers. He has owned his business for 17 years. Currently Mahmud’s car needs some repairs, so he would like to borrow 7000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS). The financing will go towards fixing his car and purchasing tires. Mahmud thanks Kiva and all the lenders who make this help possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his taxi

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 48 years old, and he lives in Ijevan. Armen is married and has five daughters: Two of them are married and live separately, and three of his daughters live with their parents. 

Since 1991, Armen has engaged in meat-produce trading, including smoked sausages, basturma (a kind of cured meat), frozen chickens, etc. He buys merchandise from villagers and also from Yerevan and sells it in Ijevan city’s market. 

Thanks to his trading profit, Armen was able to pay for his daughters’ educations, to organize their weddings and to buy necessary furniture for his house.
 
This is Armen’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon, and he is asking for a 300,000 Armenian dram loan to buy a large lot of sausages, basturma, shujukh and chickens to resell.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of sausages, basturma (cured meat), shujukh (a type of sausage) and chickens to resell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 49-year-old dairy farmer. She is a single mother of a seventeen-year-old daughter. She has been into mixed crop farming for the past year with a monthly income of 5,000 KES (~$56) which she uses for her family's needs.

She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Dorcas will use the loan to buy a dairy cow and practice dairy farming. With the anticipated profit she will support her child’s needs and venture more into dairy farming.

 Her hope is to be a milk supplier in her home town and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and practice dairy farming.

loans.name: Las Amigas De San Ildefonso Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS AMIGAS DE SAN IDELFONSO" porque como su nombre lo indica, ha nacido una gran amistad entre todas sus integrantes a lo largo que han trabajado juntas, ya que para ellas un “amigo”, es aquel que esta en las buenas y en las malas. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo en México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Leticia es integrante del grupo, tiene 28 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y tiene 3 hijos (1 mujer y 2 varones). Ella se dedica a la venta de manualidades (adornos de migajon) desde hace 6 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercancia y de esta forma hacer crecer su negocio. Solicita el prestamo para comprar materia prima como miga de plan blanco, pegamento, glicerina, pinturas para teñis, etc. Ella se siente entusiasmada ya que piensa hacer mayores inversiones, y de esta forma comenzar a tener mas ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia, debido a la gran demanda que tiene piensa rentar un local que le de mayor formalidad a su negocio y una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Amigas de San Idelfonso" because, as the name indicates, all the members have become great friends during the time that they've worked together. To them, a "friend" is someone who is there in good times and in bad. They are located in Hidalgo, Mexico. The group is made up of 10 members. 

Leticia, 28, is one group member. She studied until high school. She is a merchant and has 3 children (1 girl and 2 boys). She has been selling crafts (decorations made with a breadcrumb paste) for 6 years. She asks for a loan to invest in merchandise and help her business to grow. She wants to buy basic materials like white breadcrumbs, glue, glycerine, paints for dyeing, etc. She is excited because she thinks that making a bigger investment will begin to help her to make more money, which will allow her and her family a better quality of life. She feels a great need to rent a store where she can formalize her business and provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy input materials like white bread crumbs, glue, glycerine, paints for dyeing, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 53 años, es natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, vive en su propia casa en el poblado de Machente junto a su pareja Mauro de 39 años y sus 03 queridos hijos quienes la inspiran para seguir trabajando arduamente. María vive en las verdes praderas de su centro poblado, fuera de la contaminación de la ciudad que la mantienen con gran vitalidad para trabajar con más ahínco sus tierras, ella cultiva plantas nativas de la zona selvática, tales como: café y frutas cítricas productos que logró trabajarlos con mucha entrega para volverlos muy fructíferas. María viene labrando sus tierras desde sus 20 años y hoy es toda una conocedora de la ardua labor que se ejerce en el campo. En tiempos de cosecha y traslado de productos ella necesariamente tiene que contratar peones para apresurar su trabajo. A María le gusta su trabajo por que gracias a ello compró una piara de cerdos así obteniendo doble ingreso económico. María solicita el crédito para fortalecer sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas  razón por la cual acude a los prestamos que MFP facilita y con el préstamo solicitado comprará sacos de abono ya que con ellos sus plantas lucirán mas frondosos. Este será su 16avo crédito por la cual se siente muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo por parte de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: María is 53 and lives in her own home in Machente, Santa Rosa, with her husband Mauro and three children, who are her inspiration. María lives in the green plains far from the pollution of urban centers.  She tends crops such as coffee and citrus fruits, which require much care. María has worked her fields for 20 years and has gained much farming knowledge as a result.  During harvest and to bring products to market, she hires farm laborers. Maria recently also bought two pigs to raise, which greatly increased her revenues.  Maria now seeks this credit from MFP to buy fertiziler to increase her crop yield.  This is her 16th loan, and she is committed to prompt repayment.  The 3,000 nuevos soles will go directly to cover costs of fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer to increase crop yield

loans.name: El Carrizo Group

texts.en: The El Carrizo Solidarity Group is made up of Ana, Vilma, Kenia, and Yessica, all of whom live in Choluteca, Honudras. The group leader, Ana, makes a living by running a small convenience shop where she sells basic groceries. Ana wakes at 6:00 each morning to open the store and attend to customers. She is currently raising two children, and hopes to help them get ahead. Ana is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, bread, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, cornmeal, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

La señora  Blanca es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son como de su familia. Tiene 65 años de edad, es madre soltera  de dos hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
 
Ella desde hace mucho tiempo atrás tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y tuvo que ser padre y madre a la vez ya que el padre de sus hijos los dejo y desde allí ella tuvo que ver como sacaba a sus hijos adelante por lo cual empezó un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 18 años en este negocio y gracias a esto pudo salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante hasta que Dios se lo permita.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí.  It has been known for many years as the city of real tamarinds, due to the large quantity of this fruit that it produced years ago.  Blanca meets with her communal bank, Fe y Progreso (Faith and Progress), every two weeks.

Blanca is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because her fellow members are like family.  She is 65 and a single mother of 2 children who are independent adults.

She has had to be both mother and father to her children because the father of her children left them.  She had to take good care of her children, which is why she started a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells by going door to door and taking orders.  She sells on credit and collects from her customers every week.  She has had this business for more than 18 years, and thanks to it, she was able to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.  

Her dream is to get ahead if God will allow it.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.
