loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo, tiene la edad 56 de años, está casado  y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para asistir su cultivo de papa. El cuenta con un terreno apto ya sembrado del cultivo y quiere asistirlo para sacarle el mayor provecho de cosecha este año. El vende su producción al mercado local y quiere poder generar los ingresos necesarios para así poder salir adelante con su proyecto de papa. También quiere darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida en el futuro y cumplir planes a futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Alfredo is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 2 children who are his greatest priority.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his potato crop.  He has a good plot of land where he has already planted his crops and wants to get the most out of his harvest this year.  He sells his produce at the local market and wants to earn enough money to be able to help improve his potato farming.  He also wants to provide his family with a good quality of life in the future and fulfill his plans for the future.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not previously had any loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a convenient loan and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: plant potatoes

loans.name: Nissel

texts.en:
Nissel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Nissel has a shop where she sells sells canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nissel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nissel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Nolberto

texts.es:
Nolberto tiene 42 años, es divorciado, pero tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre decidido, él es agricultor, pero vio la oportunidad de ganar más dinero montando una tienda, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad, ya que en el barrio por donde vive, muchos de sus vecinos tienen que caminar cuadras y cuadras para poder comprar algún producto. 
Al principio sus ventas eran mínimas, porque su tienda no era aún tan conocida, pero con el pasar de los años logró posicionarse muy bien, y esto se debe a la variedad de productos como la amabilidad que trata a los clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Nolberto, age 42, is divorced and has two children.  They live together in his own house in the Pichari district.  He is known for being a determined man.  

He is a farmer, but he saw the opportunity to earn more money by setting up a store.  He sells basic needs products there.  In the neighborhood where he lives a lot of his neighbors have to walk several blocks to be able to buy a product.

In the beginning his sales were minimal because his store was not yet well-known.  However, as time passed he managed to establish himself very well.  This is due to the variety of products and the kind way he treats his customers.

This is his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to make his payments on time.  He will use the requested 3,000 sole to buy more products in order to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando es un  humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre en sus estudios a sus hijos , don Rolando desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con el recurso económico para poder darle un mejor mantenimientos a los frutos , ya que estos se encuentran de un mal color y no tienen el tamaño adecuado para la edad que tiene la piña . Don Rolando se siente contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que esto le permite rescatar su cultivo y mejorar cada ciclo su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rolando is a humble farmer from Ticuantepe area.  He lives together with his wife and children.  His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and to always support his children in their education.

Rolando has been growing pineapples for several years.  The biggest problem that he faces is that he doesn't have enough money to better care for his fruit.  His pineapples are a bad color and aren't a suitable size for their age.  Rolando feels happy with the support that Afodenic offer through their Kiva fund because it will allow him to rescue his crops and he is able to improve his quality of life with each loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru: Олим проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам он 16 лет как занимается растениеводством. У него при доме имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет для приобретения топлива, семян пшеницы и селитры.
texts.en: Olim lives in the Shahrituz region.  He is 34 years old.  He is married.  He has four children.  His wife works on the farm.  He has been growing crops for 16 years.  He has a plot of land next to his house where he grows vegetables and plants wheat.  He is taking out a loan to purchase fuel, wheat seeds and nitrates.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, wheat seeds and nitrates.

loans.name: Mwita

texts.en:
Mwita has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he took his previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings. He used the loan to buy medicine for animals, syringes and needles. This helped him to work more efficiently.
His desire is to fully establish his business in five years.
Mwita has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy vaccines.

loans.use: To buy vaccines

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her small shop where she sells hardware. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to purchase supplies and materials. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Ruth, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hardware and supplies

loans.name: Khudayor

texts.ru: Худаёр женат и ответственный отец шестерых детей. Семья очень большая и его жена работает в колхозе. Худаёр также занимается фермерством, он выращивает и продает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Он является владельцем данного бизнеса. Начинал бизнес с купли продажи мелкого рогатого скота. Имеет собственный трактор, который позволяет ему полностью собрать весь урожай и переработать землю. В бизнесе помогает ему жена и дети. Худаёр запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и мелкого рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Khudayor has got a big family. He is married and is a responsible father of six. Khudayor’s wife works in a collective farm. Khudayor is also involved in farming; he grows crops for sale. He is an owner of his own business, which he started by buying and selling cattle. He has his own tractor, which allows him to harvest the crop and prepare the land. Khudayor’s wife and children help him in his work. Khudayor is applying for a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and small livestock so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and small livestock

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi is 28 years old and is married with 4 children.
Lagi owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lagi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 145 talas or US $60 per week) to supplement her family's income and improve her business status.

Lagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lagi's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and married woman six children, five of whom are in school. She has had a business selling tea in Buluk South Sudan for three years.

Jane is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee to sell

loans.name: Razel

texts.en: Razel, a 43-year-old  married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for five years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, Razel is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
La socia Anali; pertenece al banco comunal "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Taray perteneciente a la Provincia de Pisac departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 20 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de tres meses de edad; la socia se dedica a la atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes con la compra de productos de primera necesidad como son, arroz, azucar, fideos, harinas, leche, entre otros productos que salen a diario, la socia desea seguir prosperando para dar a su menor hijo todo el apoyo necesario y tener una muy buena calida dde vida. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, aceite, azucar, fideos entre otros. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Anali belongs to the "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Taray in the province of Pisac, department of Cuzco.

She is 20 years old and in a common law marriage. She has one three month old son. She works serving customers in her small grocery store. She wants to stock her store buying basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, pasta, flours, and milk, as well as other products that go out daily. She wants to continue to prosper to give her young son everything he needs and have a good quality of life. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying products such as rice, oil, sugar, pasta and more.  

Anali is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying products such as rice, oil, pasta and more.

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar es una mujer de 47 años trabajadora y madre de dos hijas de 25 años. Estudió contabilidad, esta soltera y actualmente vive en Pachuca, Hidalgo en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
María inició su negocio hace 7 años y prosperaba muy bien. Hace poco tiempo, tuvo que cubrir gastos médicos de una de sus hijas ya que necesitaba una cirugía y esto le provocó bajas en las ventas de su tienda, pero pronto se recuperó y su tienda volvió a prosperar. 
Con las ganas de seguir creciendo su negocio, María solicitó un crédito para ayudarse a comprar mercancía, frutas y verduras y así hacer que las ventas sigan incrementándose. Hoy su negocio es próspero y sueña con tener otra tienda pero más grande y así hacer fluir más su dinero.
Su motivación más grande son sus hijas, quienes ya no dependen económicamente de ella pero les ayuda en lo que necesiten, así como sus ganas de tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia teniendo una situación económica más estable.

loans.use: comprar mercancía, frutas y verduras

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock for poultry keeping

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman is a low-income person from the Agsu district. He started his shop in 2001. He borrowed $600 from Normicro, Agsu branch to build the shop building. Now he borrows $1200 for buying spare parts to do fast repairs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Mrs. An has a child and must support her mother and her sister. Mrs. An’s mother is 78 years old and Dao, her sister, is mentally retarded. The family only has about 3000 square meters of land planted with rice, but the land is very poor and far from her home, so An has rented 2000 square meters to somebody and keeps 1000 square meters to plant rice. The family’s living depends on Mrs An’s business of buying waste materials from door to door and then selling it to the local recycling company. However, she does not have enough capital to buy much waste material so that she can earn more. Average income is low at $8/person/month. An wants to borrow a loan of $25, and she promises she will repay per month.

loans.use: buy & sell waste materials

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Mrs. Chab C. is a 51 year old widow who lives with her daughter in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a chef at a small restaurant in her area, where she can make an average of about $2.50 /day. Her daughter, meanwhile, operates a grocery store, which is assists in taking care of her entire family. Currently, Chab is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more grocery products for her daughter to keep investing in her store. In the future, she and her daughter hope to expand their business by adding a variety of products in order to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase  grocery products for her daughter to run a business

loans.name: Virila

texts.es:
Virila, 46, has been happily married to Nelson Acosta, 52, for 27 years. He works installing antenna towers for cellular telephone service. The couple had 4 children. Virila says sadly that one of them died after a long and painful illness from which the child suffered for almost two years. Because of this situation and because her husband didn’t have a steady income then, she had to go out to sell empanadas door to door. The work gave her the opportunity to meet lots of people and, as a consequence, she was able to get a place for a canteen at a local school. She’s been building the business for 6 years.

She’s always turned to loans to buy the things she needs for the canteen: a stove, microwaves, a refrigerator, etc. These appliances are basic to her daily work. On this occasion, the loan will be invested in buying a freezer that costs $300 if paid in cash.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Virila tiene 46 años, está felizmente casada hace 27 años con Nelson Acosta quien tiene 52 años. Su esposo se dedica a montar torres de antenas para telefonía celular. El matrimonio tuvo 4 hijos y Virila comenta con tristeza que uno de ellos falleció a causa de una larga y penosa enfermedad que lo tuvo postrado por casi dos años. Debido a esta situación y a que los ingresos de su esposo no eran muy constantes en ese entonces, ella tuvo que salir a vender empanadas casa por casa. Este oficio le dió la oportunidad de conocer a mucha gente y fue así que consiguió ubicarse como cantinera en una escuela de su comunidad. Hace 6 años que desarrolla dicha actividad.

Siempre recurrió a los préstamos para ir adquiriendo principalmente elementos de trabajo tales como: cocina, microondas, heladera, etc. Estos electrodomésticos son fundamentales en su trabajo diario. En esta oportunidad el crédito será invertido en la compra de una congeladora cuyo costo en el mercado es de U$S 300 al contado.

loans.use: Buy a freezer for canteen business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cesar will use the loan to buy more meat which he grills and sells to people in his area. He would also like to make repairs on his house and set up a patio area where he can serve his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her current stock level

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard Kwesi A. is a trader who sells spare parts and accessories. He's single and has no children. He is focused on increasing his income. Demand for his goods is increasingly growing but he does not have enough capital to purchase more goods to meet the demand. 

He is asking for $1,200 in additional capital to buy more car parts, especially batteries and other accessories, to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en: Natavan B. owns and operates a beauty salon in the small, northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Natavan has been working in this business for the last ten years and has successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently looking for funding so that she can purchase new equipment for her salon as well as make some minor repairs to her salon.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and to make minor repairs to her salon

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria owns a store that offers cellular phone services and calling cards. Her husband is a bricklayer, and his job is the family’s primary source of income that covers the household expenses. They live in the Rió Seco zone in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase more cell phone calling cards, in view of the high demand, thus increasing the household income.

This is her first loan with IMPRO. Maria’s credit check allows her to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene una tienda cuyos servicios son llamadas de telefonía móvil y comercialización de tarjetas de crédito para teléfonos móviles. Su esposo es albañil; siendo dicha ocupación su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos; el domicilio de la familia está ubicado en la Zona de Rió Seco (ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito será destinado para comprar más tarjetas de créditos para teléfonos móviles, en vista de que su demanda ha aumentado y de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Maria.

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone calling cards

loans.name: Mirzokarim

texts.ru:
Mirzokarim N. lives in the town Tursun-zoda. He is married and has 5 children. He works as a tinsmith mainly producing custom orders. This is not a very stable source of income. The main source of Mirzokarim's income, however, is agriculture. He owns a piece of land, where he plants potatoes and wheat. To plant, he needs good quality seeds and fertilizers, which Mirzokarim cannot afford. For this reason, he is asking for a loan.

After collecting crops, he will be able to provide the market with quality products, attract new customers, and obtain sufficient profits. In addition, he will be able to provide his family with flour and potatoes for a long period of time (potatoes and flour products are the main foods consumed by residents of the region). He is planning to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Назаров Мирзокарим проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Он женат и имеет 5 детей. Работает жестянщиком на заказ. Это не стабильный заработок клиента. Основным источником дохода его семьи и основным видом деятельности клиента является сельское хозяйство. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. На засев земли необходимы качественные семена и удобрения , на покупку которых у клиента нет средств. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. После получения качественного урожая клиент сможет обеспечить рынок качественной продукцией , привлечь новых клиентов и получить неплохой доход. Кроме того он сможет обеспечить свою семью мукой и картофелем на долгое время , так как основным продуктом питания населения является мука( хлеб и хлебные изделия) и картофель. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Mr. Bo S. makes around $4.50 per day fishing and farming. His wife, Mrs. Khan Chea, 36, makes $2.90 per day selling used goods and breeding pigs. S. and Chea live with their five children in Sramor Thom Village, Siem Reap Province. Their children are young students, so they can’t help to make money for their family. S. and Chea request a loan of $1,200 to purchase farmland and buy fishing equipment.

loans.use: To purchase farmland and buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana owns her house, which is equipped with all the modern amenities. She lives with her 8-year-old daughter, who is studying at a business school. Mariana promotes cosmetics and jewelry and makes sales by special order. She has a solid client base and three years’ experience in the field. There is some competition in this sales field, but Mariana owes her success to her good relationships with her clients and the way she presents her products’ new features. This loan request is for the purchase of a line of products from Yanbal, Avon and Ebel, which Mariana will buy wholesale to be able to offer better prices. Mariana also has a good credit history.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Mariana tiene una casa propia que esta dotada de todos los servicios básicos, vive junto a su hija que tiene 8 años de edad que actualmente está estudiando en una escuela fiscal. Mariana trabaja como promotora de cosméticos y joyas realizando ventas a pedido, cuenta con clientela segura y experiencia de tres años en el rubro. Existe competencia en el rubro, sin embargo el éxito radica en su buen relacionamiento con su clientela y la presentación de novedades en sus articulos. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de productos de la línea Yanbal, Avon, Ebel que los compra al por mayor con precios de oferta. Tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen A., 27, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and young child. She sells groceries and ice out of her home, making around $3 each day, while her husband, a fisherman, sells his catch for $3 each day. Inconsistent weather conditions and high inflation have made Cambodia a very difficult place to earn a living as a fisherman. In the midst of economic struggles, though, Pen A. has seen how she can expand her husband’s business through the purchase of some new tools. She has therefore approached CREDIT for a loan of $200 to purchase some new fishing equipment to enable her husband to increase his daily catch.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.en:
D. Jean Jacques is a young, talented woman living in the small Haitian community of Loma Bajito in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. She is the only caretaker of her two kids (ages 16 and 19) after her husband passed away. She intends to use this loan to purchase pants, blouses, shoes, perfumes, and cosmetics. She will sell her inventory on the streets both in and outside of her community. D.´s business will help feed her kids and provide an education for them. She hopes to own and run a "colmado" (a small convenient store that provides basic supplies) someday. 

D. Jean Jacques is part of a five-person micro-bank, Paz y Amor, which means "Peace and Love." The group is composed of all Haitian immigrants living in the same community of Loma Bajito. Each woman has her own personal business, but they unite to pay their loan as a group. The purpose of the group loan is to assist each other in case someone defaults. Loans are divided among the group to pay back. 

We thank you for your support on behalf of D., the Paz and Amor group, and the entire team at Esperanza International.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, shoes, perfumes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Khaitgul

texts.en:
Khaitgul A. is 36 years old. She is divorced with three children. She started a clothing sales business in her home town of Shahrituz in order to pay for personal expenses and the education of her children. She started with a little merchandise, and little by little she has increased her sales and clientele. It has not been easy for Khaitgul to shoulder all of the responsibilities of her house, but the love of her children makes it worth it. In the photo you see Khaitgul’s eldest daughter, who helps her mother with the business.

Today Khaitgul needs a loan of 3100 Somoni (925 USD) to buy new merchandise in order to have new products and attract new clients. She promises to repay this loan in 6 months. You can contribute to improving the living conditions of this family. Your help is a great blessing for them.

loans.use: Purchase of new children’s clothing to broaden her inventory

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap H., 54, H. been selling groceries in Samakie Village since 1979. She sells meat, vegetable, and other food items from her house, and earns around 12,000 Riel ($3) per day. Her husband, Mr. Seng Ly, 56, sells Khmer noodles. Sopheap H. four children, two of whom are tailors and another one works as mirror cutter. The children help support the family.

Sopheap H. attracted a lot of customers, but she lacks the capital to purchase more groceries and increase her stock of goods for expanding the business. Sopheap heard about the low-interest loans and quality service that Kiva offers through Hattha Kaksekar Limited. So she is requesting a loan 1,100,000 Riel ($275) to increase the inventory of groceries to sell. She plans to use the loan to improve her business and increase her income to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aida habita el barrio Carlos Fonseca, barrió ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 54 años de edad, se encuentra soltera y tiene  4 hijos. Actualmente la señora Aída se dedica a la docencia, prestando los servicios de docencia en primaria y a la vez se dedica a vender cosméticos, donde tiene 3 años de dedicarse a estas actividades, ella requiere de financiamiento para poder seguir creciendo con su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos y perfumes, por tanto esta solicitando un crédito de C$ 7,000 aun plazo de 8 meses, para la compra de mercadería y poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes y a la vez de esta forma obtener mas ingresos y poder ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aida lives in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is 54 years old and single with 4 children. Aida works as a teacher, lending her services to elementary school teaching, and at the same time, operates a cosmetics sales business. She's been operating the business for 3 years. She needs financing to continue growing her small business, selling cosmetics and perfumes, so she's asking for a C$7,000 loan, for 8 months, to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider range of products to her customers. She wants to increase her income and be able to help improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: This young man is a laboratory assistant. He has been in this business for 2 years. Habil was born in 1975. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in the Absheron region. He is single. Now, Habil needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things for his laboratory.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for his laboratory

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.en: Rukhsora is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her children. Rukhsora works diligently caring for cows at a facility in her home, which she then sells at various fairs in the area. She shows the same dedication to the small creatures that she shows to her small children, and, in a short amount of time, they have provided her with excellent earnings. She is eager to increase the capacity of her animal care facilities to accommodate a greater number of animals. With your strong support, she will be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Hanifan Maqbool Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 32-year-old married lady and resides in a small area called Riwind in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She has lived in this city with her family for the past 32 years. She married a man whose name is M. A.. He is involved in a catering business with an experience of 15 years.

Hanifan baji is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. None of her children goes to school. Hanifan baji has been a midwife for the past 15 years. She invests the profits from her work in a committee and plans to renovate the house when it is her turn to receive the amount. She is applying for a loan to buy furniture and table covers and chair covers for her husband’s catering business.

Hanifan baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Parveen baji and Kosar baji and Sobia baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruit for their fruit-selling businesses. Razia baji wants a loan to buy raw materials (leather and nails) for her shoemaking business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy furniture etc. for catering business

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Mr. Noeun N., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Huon Ul, 34, have been married for 15 years and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are in school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Noeun and his wife have been selling fish and vegetables for five years. They buy them from Prek Toch market about fifteen kilometers from their home for re-sale at the market in Phnom Penh. Noerun is the process of building his new house but he lacks money to finish part of it. So, he is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to add to his own money to finish his house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to finish his house

loans.name: Novelina

texts.en:
Novelina C. is already a widow and she was left with their only daughter Llewelyn, 26 years old and working in the City Hall of Santiago City. Novelina is grateful and proud of her daughter for being responsible in the absence of her husband. 

She manages a sari-sari store (a community based store) business in their village. She is thankful that she is generating a weekly income of PHP1,000.00 that she uses as a rolling capital and to provide their basic needs and some medicines since she is prone to sickness.  Aside from her store, Novelina is also planning to start in the hog raising business for additional income.  With this, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use for business expansion.  With her small businesses, she can save something for herself for she does not want to depend too much on her daughter financially, especially when she gets sick.  She hopes that her request will be granted by the lenders.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana J. A. es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee no posee estudios. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 07 años, su negocio es la venta de golosinas y bebidas (galletas, gaseosas, golosinas, etc.), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (principalmente gaseosas y galletas).  
Actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio (golosinas, bebidas y galletas, principalmente) ello lo podrá vender al menor y mayor solo en las ferias de desaguadero (Martes y Viernes); ella tiene el deseo de contar con una tienda grande de abarrotes y los productos que viene ofreciendo actualmente; asumimos desea adquirir una casa y brindarles una profesión a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliana J. A. is a member of the "Corazones Unidos" Community Bank, in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno; she is 43 years old, married, has 5 children and has no studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years, her business is the sale of candy and soft drinks (cookies, soft drinks, candy, etc.); her first loan was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she was able to acquire merchandise for her business (mainly soft drinks and cookies). Currently she needs a new loan of S/.500.00 New Soles, which she plans to repay in four monthly installments, and which she will use to buy more merchandise for her business (mainly candy, drinks and cookies), which she will be able to sell wholesale and retail only at the open markets on Tuesdays and Fridays. She wants to have a large grocery store to sell the products she now sells, and we expect she would like to buy a house and help her children get a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de más mercaderías:golosinas,bebidas,etc

loans.name: Natividad Julia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Natividad L. se dedica con gran esfuerzo y dedicación a su actividad de elaboración  y venta de tortillas teniendo este negocio en su casa de habitación donde a diario  es visitada por sus clientes que compran dichas tortillas.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una muy excelente trabajadora y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra del maíz ya que requiere de este para continuar elaborando las ricas tortillas y así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Natividad Lopez works with great effort and dedication preparing and selling tortillas in the city of Chinandega. She works from her one room home, where she is visited daily by her clients, who stop by to buy her tortillas. She is an excellent worker and is coming to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan to buy corn to prepare her delicious tortillas and keep on growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn to prepare tortillas

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is a fifty-eight-year-old married man and a father of five. The first four born are currently in senior high and junior high schools. The youngest has yet to start school. His wife is a petty trader. She trades in food items such as yams, plantains, cassava, and the like. Kwame lives with the family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is farming and a busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.
 
Kwame is in the sand winning business. He acquires pieces of land, hires workers who dig for the sand and sells the product to building contractors in dump trucks. After winning the sand, the land returns to the owner from whom he acquired it.

Kwame has been in business for fifteen years. He hopes to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To acquire a piece of land for sand winning

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La microempresaria Estela M. A. tiene 40 años es casada tiene 5 hijos, todos se encuentran estudiando en nivel primario y secundario. La señora M. se dedica a administrar una pulpería desde hace 4 años, ya que su marido es albañil y no todo el tiempo tiene trabajo por lo que aprovecho para tener un pequeño ahorro y de esta manera inicio su negocio para poder garantizar el sustento diario de su familia aportando a los ingresos que lleva a la casa su marido.

La señora M. considera que si en su negocio se atiende bien a sus clientes, estos siempre le van a comprar sus productos y de esta manera es que ella mantiene su clientela. La microempresaria M. ya ha sido beneficiada con un crédito con Kiva, dicha crédito le permitió aumentar su inventario y ahora su pulpería esta mas surtida. Sin embargo prefiere tener muchos productos en existencia por el aumento en los precios que se dan regularmente y poder tener mejores ganancias.

Esta solicitando para comprar lo siguiente: 3 quintales de Arroz americano a US 55 el quintal, 3 quintales de azúcar a US 35 el quintal, 2 quintales de frijoles a US 56 el quintal, 3 bidones de  aceite a US 15 el bidón, 3 bolsones de papel higiénico a US 12 el bolsón, 5 cajas de huevos a US 8 la caja, 3 cajas de leche la lechera a US 15 la caja, 85 libras de pollo a US 1.20 cada libra, y 5 cajas de sopas 3 minutos (maruchan) a US 10 cada caja.
texts.en:
The small-businesswoman Estela M. A., 40, is married with 5 children, all studying in primary and secondary schools. Señora M. has earned her living running a small grocery store for the last 4 years. Since her husband is a bricklayer and does not always have work, they used their small savings to start her business in order to take care of the daily expenses of the family, adding to the income that her husband brings home. Señora M. believes that if she takes good care of her clients, they will always buy her products, so this is the way she maintains her clientele. The small-businesswoman M. has taken one loan through Kiva that allowed her to increase her inventory, and now her shop is better supplied. Nevertheless she prefers to keep stock on hand against the price increases that come regularly, to be able to have better profits. She is requesting to buy the following: 300 Kg of American rice at US $55 per 100 Kg, 300 Kg of sugar at US $35 per 100 Kg, 200 Kg of beans at US $56 per 100 Kg, 3 cans of oil at US $15 per can, 3 cases of toilet tissue at US $12 per case, 5 boxes of eggs at US $8 per box, 3 cartons of La Lechera milk at US $15 the carton, 85 pounds of chicken at US $1.20 per pound, and 5 cases of Maruchan 3-minute soups at US $10 per case.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Anthonia is 32 years old and married with two children. She owns a computer center, and is requesting a loan of 90,000 NGN to purchase a laminating machine to enable her to laminate documents for her customers. Anthonia sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a laminating machine

loans.name: William

texts.fr: William A. est âgé de 28 ans, mariés et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il exerce ce métier depuis trois ans. William désire avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle et bailler la première à une autre personne contre des redevances mensuelles.
texts.en:
William A. is 28 years old, maried, and the father of one child. He drives a taxi-moto (i.e. a motorcycle taxi) in Lomé, the capital city of Togo. He has done this job for three years. With this credit, William wishes to buy a new motorcycle and lease the first one to another person for monthly payments.

Translated from French by Laura Buhler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Dodji est un peintre, il est très réputé  dans son quartrier, pour bien exercer son activité, il a ouvert une boutique qu’il a appelé « DODJI PEINTURE ». Il veut acheter certains matériaux de construction et sollicite pour cela de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 sacs de granelite, 28 sacs de poudre de marbre, 10 bidons de colle azarfix et divers matériaux de construction. Il est marié et a 01 enfant.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Dodji is a painter. He is highly reputable in his area. To operate his business, he opened a shop he calls “DODJI PEINTURE”. He wants to buy certain construction supplies and is therefore requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 30 sacks of Granelite, 28 sacks of marble powder, 10 drums of Azarfix glue, and various other construction supplies. He is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Granelite, glues, marble, and various construction supplies

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. sells provisions and drinks. She is 45 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Назирчон

texts.ru: Турсунбоев Н. продолжает расширять свою деятельность .Назир  год является клиентом МЗФ Микроинвест. Он занимается услугой по ремонту сотовых трубок. Целенаправленно используя займ он улучшил качество  обслуживания. Назир планирует  расширить свою деятельность  продажей сотовых трубок. На  запрашиваемый займ он хочет закупить сотовые трубки.

loans.use: На закупку сотовых трубок

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Milka tiene 25 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y sus 2 hermanos. Su actividad diaria es la venta de bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas), negocio que lo tiene en su propia casa y logra que Milka salga adelante. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3 años, a razón de encontrarse en una zona muy concurrida y cerca de un lugar turístico, donde acuden personas de todo lugar y debido al calor de la región consumen frecuentemente de las bebidas que ella ofrece. A Milka le gusta su trabajo porque por medio del mismo conoce a muchas personas con quienes mantiene amenas conversaciones, además que con las ganancias que le genera este negocio puede solventar sus estudios profesionales. 

Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que todos demuestran responsabilidad, por lo que hay confianza y unión. Con el dinero que Milka viene solicitando comprará sillas, mesas y más bebidas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Milka is 25, single, and she lives with her parents and two siblings. Her daily work is selling drinks (soft drinks and beer). She has the business in her own house, and it enables Milka to get ahead. She has been doing this work for three years. She is located in a busy area and near a tourist place. People from all over frequently buy her drinks due to the regional heat. Milka likes her work because she gets to know a lot of people and have friendly conversations with them. Also, she is able to pay for her professional studies with the income generated from this business. This is her third loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her group is that they all demonstrate responsibility, which has led to confidence and unity. Milka will use the money she is asking for to buy chairs, tables, and more drinks for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for her business and increase merchandise

loans.name: Alice E

texts.en:
Alice E. T. lives in the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She makes a living as a farmer, growing mostly rice. Alice has been engaged in this business for more than 22 years, and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Alice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. Alice has successfully repaid four previous loans from GDMPC which she has used to buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alice has applied for a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is made up mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
SANTA ROSA: 

Grupo conformado por doce personas, quienes se dedican al alquiler de prendas de vestir y accesorios para todo tipo de evento: matrimonios, quince años, bautizo, ternos para niños y adultos, zapatos. La mercadería que ellos alquilan es comprada en Gamarra - Lima; Gamarra es un gran centro comercial e industrial peruano en el rubro textil de personas microempresarias, allí podemos encontrar diversidad de opciones para cualquier edad; los productos que ellos fabrican son exportados a otros países.

Esta alcancía comunal trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROPERIDAD hace un año, tiempo que Jessica sigue asumiendo el cargo de tesorera del grupo.
Jessica V. U. antes de emprender en el negocio de alquiler de prendas para caballeros y niños, estudió en un CEO corte y confección, gracias a los trabajos de compostura y confección que hacía juntó el capital necesario para la inversión de alquiler de prendas. Al inicio compró 20 ternos para adultos y 10 para niños, 1 docena de zapatos para niños, 1 docena de corbatas, 1 docena de camisas; han trascurrido seis años y se aprecia que su negocio ha crecido mucho, todo se debe a la dedicación y perseverancia que tuvo frente a las dificultades que en todo negocio se da. Hoy en día a sus 29 años cuenta con 100 ternos para adultos y 90 de niños, 5 docenas de zapatos, 4 docenas de corbatas y 8 docenas de caminas; cada medio año tiene que renovar su mercadería debido a la exigencia de los clientes que viven los cambios de la moda. Sus ventas han hecho posible adquirir un pequeño terreno que piensa construir más adelante, además desea alquilar otro puesto que no tardará más de dos años en juntar la inversión necesaria a fin de iniciar una familia; es por ello que necesita el crédito.


Sofía F. H., empezó a trabajar como ayudante en una librería que administraba su tía, el negocio no resultó como se esperaba; lo que la obligó a trabajar en club campestres vendiendo duces, helados, algodón de dulce, canchita; pero estos ingresos no era lo suficiente para mantener a su bebé y así misma. Desde entonces hace tres años emprendió en el negocio de ropa de alquiler para damas y niñas, al inicio ayudaba a su tía en el negocio y luego hizo sociedad con ella.
Compró 15 vestidos para damas y niñas; con su dedicación y esfuerzo hizo crecer sus ventas alcanzando tener 200 vestidos y 50 pares de calzado para niñas y damas. Con estos ingresos brinda educación a su hijo, alimentación y paga sus estudios en la universidad en la carrera de educación inicial. Utilizará este crédito para pagar su último semestre en la universidad y la otra parte en su negocio.

Rita Alegría E. también alquila vestidos y ternos para distintos compromisos sociales, ella y una amiga empezaron con una pequeña cantidad de mercadería hace dos años, al igual que las demás compra la mercadería en Gamarra si se trata de ropa y los zapatos en talleres de calzados. Renueva sus prendas cada cierto tiempo, necesita el préstamo para adquirir más mercadería porque se aproxima la campaña de primavera y promociones de colegios (noviembre y diciembre); meses que hay mayor demanda y por ende sus ingresos se incrementan.
Quiere construir en la casa de su madre un cuarto para la comodidad de su hijo de 13 años y tener una adecuada calidad de vida ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa The group is comprised of 12 members who rent clothing and accessories for all types of events: weddings, 15 year old birthday celebrations, and baptisms. They rent out suits for children and adults, and shoes. The merchandise that they rent is purchased in Gamarra - Lima. Gamarra is a large commercial and industrial center in Peru, and it is big in the field of textiles for business people. We can find a variety of options for whatever age there. The products they make are exported to other countries. This communal bank has worked with EDAPROSPO-PROPERIDAD for one year. During that time Jessica continues to be the treasurer of the group. Before starting in the business of renting gentlemen’s and children’s clothing, Jessica V. U. studied design and production in an educational and occupational center. Thanks to her work making and repairing clothes she got together the necessary capital to invest in renting clothing. At the beginning she bought 20 suits for adults and 10 for children, one dozen pairs of children’s shoes, one dozen ties, and one dozen shirts. Six years have passed, and she appreciates that the business has grown a lot. Everything is due to the dedication and perseverance she had when confronted with the problems that all businesses have. Today, at 29 years old, she has 100 suits for adults, 90 for children, 5 dozen pairs of shoes, 4 dozen ties, and 8 dozen shirts. Every half year she has to update her merchandise due to her discriminating customers who go with the changing fashions. Her sales have made it possible for her to acquire a small piece of land, which she plans to build on later. She would also like to rent another place so that it will not take more than two years to get together the money that is needed to start a family. That is why she needs a loan. Sofía F. H. started working as a helper in a bookstore that her aunt ran. The business did not turn out the way she hoped. She then had to work in golf clubs selling candy, ice cream, cotton candy, and popcorn. But, this income was not enough to support her and her baby. Three years ago she set up a business of renting clothing for women and girls. At the start she helped her aunt in the business, and then she became partners with her. She bought 15 dresses for women and girls. Her dedication and effort caused her sales to grow, and she has come to have 200 dresses and 50 pairs of shoes for women and girls. With this income she educates her son, buys food, and pays for her studies in primary education at the university. She will use this loan to pay for her last semester at the university, and the other part of the loan she will put into her business. Rita Alegría E. also rents dresses and suits for special social events. She and a friend started with a small quantity of merchandise two years ago. Like the others, she buys merchandise in Gamarra if she wants clothing, and she gets shoes in footwear shops. She updates her clothes every so often. She needs the loan to get more merchandise because the spring season and school promotions (November and December) are approaching. There is a greater demand during those months, and her income increases. She wants to build a room in her mother’s house for her 13 year old son to be more comfortable. She wants to have an adequate quality of life for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy textile products

loans.name: Jesus Loves You Group

texts.en:
Jesus Loves You is a group of five borrowers led by Irantatie P., a 50-year-old married woman with five children. Her children are aged beween 26 and 32 years old and have attained education from 9th grade to university graduate. Irantatie herself is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in Virginia, a newly-built community north of the capital, Monrovia, for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lot.

Irantatie's business is selling charcoal and palm oil. She buys these wholesale from farmers in rural Liberia and sells them retail to residents of Virginia. She has been running this business for 30 years and hopes to expand it. Irantatie sells good quality palm oil and charcoal and talks to her customers in a courteous manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and charcoal. Irantatie dreams that she and her family will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and charcoal

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna O. is from the village of Butuay. She is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business providing recycling services. She hauls plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. Lorna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Franklin Elio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FRANKLIN, SE SEPARO DE SU ESPOSA HACE UN PAR DE AÑOS ATRÁS TIENE 2 HIJOS QUIENES ESTAN AL CUIDADO DE SU MAMÁ, A UN PRINCIPIO EL COLABORABA EN EL NEGOCIO A SU MADRE QUIEN TIENE LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD, YA CON EL PASAR DE LOS AÑOS EL DECIDE INDEPENDISARSE Y EMPRENDER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO, ES ASI COMO LLEGA A NUESTRA INSTITUCIÓN, SIENDO EMPRENDER EL LUGAR DE DONDE SACO SU PRIMER CREDITO DEBIDO A LA CONFIANZA Y A LO BIEN QUE LE VA EL SOLICITA RENOVAR SU CREDITO, ES UNA PERSONA JOVEN QUIEN TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERARSE Y ESPERA A UN FUTURO TENER UN NEGOCIO MAS AMPLIO DEL QUE TIENE AHORA PARA SOLVENTAR A SUS HIJOS QUE SON MENORES DE EDAD Y SON EL IMPULSO PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Franklin separated from his wife a few years ago. He has 2 children who are in the care of their mom. Originally, he worked together in the same business as his mother. Over the years, he has decided to become independent and start his own business. Thus, he comes to our institution, with Emprender being the place where he took out his first loan. Due to familiarity and how well it's going for him, he is requesting a loan renewal. He is a young man who has the desire to overcome challenges and hope for a future in which he would have a business that has expanded beyond what he currently has in order to provide for his children who are minors and are his reason for carrying on.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will invest in the purchase of motors and accessories.

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
La señora Yolith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Lleva 02 años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, gracias a las ganancias obtenidas, con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 logró implementar su negocio, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, hoy sus vecinos y amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca y piensa seguir adelante y prosperar con otros negocios.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará abarrotes como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, paquetes de leches y aceites; gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolith belongs to the communal bank "Corazon de Jesus", in the district of San Jose de Sisa, province of Dorado, and department of San Martin. She is married, 40 years old, and is the mother of three children, two of whom still depend on her. For two years she has worked selling groceries, thanks to the earnings she has obtained. With her first credit of S/ 300.00 she managed to set up her business, which is located in her house, a very well-equipped place to attend to her customers. Today her neighbors and friends know her well, and she is very well accepted. Her sales are going just fine, and she plans to keep moving ahead and prosper with other businesses. With this loan of S/ 1,000.00, she will purchase groceries such as: sacks of rice and sugar, packages of milk and oil, soft drinks of different flavors and sizes, and materials for cleaning her home and personal hygiene. In this way she will be able to keep her clients satisfied and content. She is very satisfied with the job that she performs. She believes that it is worth the sacrifice to fulfill her dreams and goals that she has laid out in her life. Likewise, she thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing support to her and other women that want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase groceries to increase her variety of products

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 36-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Hassan has been working as a car painter for twelve years. Hassan requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a machine for his work. This machine will help him improve his work, as well as his quality of work. Hassan has been a micro-credit client for six years now and has always repaid on time.

His previous loan helped his improve his work by being more efficient and improving his work quality. Hassan is special in his work because of his efficiency. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Hassan first started his business, he had to face competition. Hassan decided on doing his work because of his experience and because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for his work

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie G. is a 29-year old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is only six years old. Melanie has been engaged in farming since 2004. 

Melanie tells us that she is now preparing her farm for the next planting. She will need seeds, fertilizer, and other farming inputs. She is requesting a CEVI loan in the amount of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). With this loan, Melanie will be able to purchase the supplies she needs for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel is married with two sons and a daughter. His family of five lives in Vodyanoye. Pavel used to have a greenhouse, where he would grow tomatoes, radishes, parsley, etc. He’s had it for nine years. One winter night, heavy snow and strong winds blew it away and ruined its framework. This is why Pavel now needs to reconstruct his greenhouse for the upcoming farming season. 

Pavel has about 30,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. He spends 10,000 to 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. Pavel is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to construct a bigger, durable greenhouse to ensure better, richer harvests and additional income as a result. 

Note: In the photo, Pavel is standing in front of his ruined greenhouse.

loans.use: To construct a new greenhouse

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda S. B. is twenty five years old, divorced, and has one child who is five and half years old. Her business is located at Khayega, a busy local market in Kakamega. She sells vegetables, onions and tomatoes to the local people. She has engaged in this kind of business for the last four years despite the fact that competition is high because there are many people in the area engaged in the same kind of business as hers. 

She is using her loan to buy a cow and a donkey. A cow will give her milk to consume at home and she will sell the excess to the local people. A donkey will enable her to transport her goods from one place to another. She dreams of buying her own land and building her own shop. She also sees herself being the biggest green-grocer in Khayega. She is a very hardworking and determined lady.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a donkey

loans.name: D. Gilberte

texts.fr: Née le 03 Décembre 1971, D. D. Gilberte est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Gilberte ne vit plus avec son mari. Gilberte vit donc seule avec ses enfants à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Gilberte mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de différentes sauces) à Agla. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Gilberte achète ses produits. Gilberte  a 15 ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de cette activité, et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Gilberte ambitionne renforcer son activité et augmenter sa production journalière afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Gilberte sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born December 3, 1971, D. Gilberte D. is the mother of three children, all having attended school, and of whom two are under her care. Gilberte no longer lives with her husband, and thus lives with her children in the Agla area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. To cope with her various expenses Gilberte sells food preparations (corn mush with different sauces) in Agla. She gets her ingredients from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Gilberte has 15 years’ experience in this activity, and has already been granted two loans by ALIDé, both repaid in full. Much in demand by customers, Gilberte wants to strengthen her activity and increase her daily production to meet the ever-increasing demand for her product. That is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of corn and sauce ingredients (tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Lisette Del Socorro

texts.en:
Lisette del Socorro S. C. is a 42-year-old mother of 4 from San Rafael de Alajuela, located in the northern region of Costa Rica. She runs a beauty salon called ¨Peluqueria El Rey¨ which translates roughly as the ¨The King's Hair Salon.¨ Lisette specializes in hair alterations, hair dyeing, and straightening. She opened her business 3 years ago with an initial investment of 800,000 colons. 

Lisette works with two employees, and in a good month (December to May) she can earn 400,000 colons; in a bad month (May to October) only 300,000. Lisette dedicates the hours from 9:30 am to 7 pm, 5 days per week, to her business.

Lisette will use this loan to make general investments in hair products, salon furniture and hair alteration equipment (e.g., hair straighteners) which will allow her to provide better services to her clients. A long-term objective of Lisette’s is to open a second beauty salon.

loans.use: For the purchase of hair products and salon equipment.

loans.name: La Prueba Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Prueba está conformado por tres mujeres excepcionales una de ellas es la señora Zonia quien en sus inicios recorría las calles de su pueblo, Reparto Roberto Lara zona rural de Nindiri, con un canasto en su cabeza ofertando los productos como yuca, papa, cebolla, tomate etc. luego invirtió en un carretón  para caballo lo que le permitió salir adelante.

Actualmente además de vender ambulante  tiene un pequeño puesto de verduras en su casa. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería como yuca, ayote, pián, pepino, tomate, naranja, pitaya y piña entre otros para seguir progresando y poder apoyar a sus hijos menores los cuales estudian uno está en la universidad y otro en su último año de bachillerato.

Sus compañeras de grupo son  Simona del Carmen L. la que realiza y vende  raspado, un postre típico nicaragüense que consiste en hielo granizado y miel, mientras Reyna Espinosa de 39 años de edad es comerciante de  frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental desde los 7 años. Ellas invertirán su crédito en la compra de materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group “La Prueba” (The Proof) consists of three exceptional women. One of them is Sra. Zonia, who started her business traveling through the streets of her town, Reparto Roberto Lara, a rural area of Nindiri. She carried a basket on her head filled with products such as cassava, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and other items. She later bought a horse-drawn carriage that allowed her to get ahead. Zonia currently sells as a street vendor with a small vegetable stand outside of her house. She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise such as cassava, squash, cucumbers, tomatoes, oranges, “pitaya” (dragon fruit), pineapple, and other items so that she can continue progressing and support her children. They are attending school, one is in university and the other is in the last year of high school. Her fellow group members are Simona del Carmen L., who prepares and sells “raspado”, a traditional Nicaraguan dessert that consists of crushed ice and honey. Meanwhile, Reyna Espinosa is 39 years old and has been selling fruit and vegetables at the eastern market for seven years. They will invest their loans in the purchase of raw materials for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Bayardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo tiene 41 años, por lo que anteriormente ya había solicitado un financiamiento pues fue de gran ayuda. Posee un una pequeña industria de bolis que son refrescos en bolsa, los cuales luego sale a distribuir en una camioneta que posee. Algo que alega tener problemas actualmente es el alza del combustible, pero siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Por lo que l crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima que necesita para su negocio. Su sueño consiste en realizar la compra de otro medio de transporte que le permita ampliar más la distribución de su negocio y poder brindar más estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Bayardo, age 41, previously applied for a loan which was of great assistance. He has a small factory producing bolis, a soft drink sold in plastic bags. He then distributes this from his pickup truck.

He tells us that sometimes he has problems, currently with the rise in the price of fuel, but he is always looking for ways to progress. The loan he is applying for is for the purchase of raw materials that he needs for his business. His dream is to purchase another means of transport that will permit him to increase his business’ sales and offer more stable earnings for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum Y. is 51 years old and is married to Soung Rorn, 46, who fishes in and around the lakes of his community.

For more than ten years, Phum Y. has been selling fresh fish by delivering it around her community. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing operation or that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen.

Currently, the family faces difficulty traveling because they have no vehicle. Thus, Phum Y. decided to seek a loan of $1,100 to purchase a used motorcycle to provide transportation for the family. As the quantity of fish caught is declining due to the lack of fishing gear, she will use the remaining money from the loan to buy more equipment for her husband to use when fishing.

This couple takes care of three kids who are students in the high school.

loans.use: To purchase a used-motorcycle and fishing equipment

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila S. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Laila is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a charcoal store.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Store more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El cliente es propietario de una despensa el cual lo maneja con su señora.
 Es padre de 2 hijos menores de edad, estudiantes. Don Miguel también es constructor, y albañil, es una persona trabajador, sacrificada y emprendedora, que con sacrificio y esfuerzo apoyado por su familia han llevado adelante el negocio, la educación de sus hijos y un nivel de vida bueno.
Miguel accedió al préstamo para invertir en la ampliación de su casa donde el mismo se encarga de realizar la construcción.
El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción y agradecimiento por la confianza al trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su negocio y la de su familia.-
texts.en:
This client owns a grocery store, which he manages with his wife. He has two minor children; they are students. Miguel is also a builder and a bricklayer. He is a hard-working, self-sacrificing, and enterprising person. Through sacrifice, effort, and support from his family he has gotten ahead in business, been able to educate his children, and has achieved a good standard of living. Miguel got the loan to invest in expanding his house. He personally will be in charge of the construction. The client expresses his satisfaction and gratitude for the trust shown in working with the Fundación. He is also grateful for the help in the development and growth of his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bricks, wood, cement, and other things

loans.name: Gelane Musico Group

texts.en:
Gelane M. is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Gelane is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gelane is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gelane owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gelane has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Gelane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gelane is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Gelane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia R. is an entrepreneur and a married woman.  She runs a business selling traditional clothes (Vitenge ang Khanga) at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She purchases goods from wholesale and retail shops in the Mnazi Mmoja business shopping center and sells them to retail customers.

Her business plan is to open more shops as her business income grows. She is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Glorio

texts.es: Glorio, de 25 años, es un joven luchador que hace un año se divorció de su pareja, tiene dos menores hijos, a quien ve los fines de semana. La agricultura, es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 8 años, desde entonces cultiva café, plátanos, frutas cítricas y piña, sobre terrenos que posee. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus familiares, pero en épocas de cosecha, necesariamente contrata operarios para agilizar su labor. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar los granos de café, despulparlos, lavarlos, secarlos y escogerlos para luego comercializarlo a los mayoristas, quienes conocen la calidad de su fruto y por el cual pagan montos considerables. El plantar café, es muy rentable, pues le permite adquirir sus bienes, cubrir sus gastos y la de sus hijos, por eso en adelante planea, incrementar la producción de este fruto pero en mejor calidad. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y asegura que se siente orgullos de seguir trabajando en su grupo comunal, junto a las personas que considera honestas, trabajadores y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará dos mil plantas de café y sacos de abono, así podrá renovar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Glorio, 25, is a young man who is a real fighter. He divorced his wife a year ago, and sees his two young children on weekends. He has done agricultural work since he was 8, having grown coffee, bananas, citrus fruits and pineapple on land that he owns. Sometimes he receives help from his relatives, but at harvest time he has to contract labor to speed up the work. He likes to harvest the coffee beans, pulp them, wash them, then select the ones to sell to the wholesalers who know the quality of his crop and who will pay considerable sums. Planting coffee is very profitable, allowing him to purchase his necessities, and to cover his expenses and those of his children. Therefore, for the future he plans to increase his production of this crop. This is the second time he has taken a loan through MFP, and he is very proud to continue to work with his communal group, with persons he considers to be honest, hard-working and responsible. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy two thousand more coffee plants and sacks of fertilizer to revitalize his plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying supplies for preparing ice cream and paying the vendors for their work

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan I. is from the village of Punit. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Susan owns and operates a general store which offers a variety of products to the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

In 2009, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Susan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI ”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria;  La socia tiene 65 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos,  dos de ellos independientes; La socia trabaja en el mercado de san Pedro vendiendo jugos en la misma sección; Ella  trabaja desde hace 44 años y es muy conocida y ahora solicita el préstamo para incrementar su capital y mejorar su negocio e implementarlo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en implementar su negocio de jugos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the Virgen de Chapi communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

The client is Maria. She is 65 years old, married, and has 6 children, 2 of which are independent. She works in the market of San Pedro selling juices and has been working for the past 44 years. She is well known and she is now requesting this loan to increase her capital and invest in implementing her juice business.
