Maria is grateful for and values the loan provided and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in implementing her juice business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Dapaon. She is 50 years old. Anita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Kasanje Twegate-Lugazi Group

texts.en:
54-year-old Immaculate M. is married and a mother of six. She belongs to the Kasanje Twegate-Lugazi Group. By operating a grocery store for the last thirty years in Kasanje-Lugazi, Immaculate has been able to put food on her family’s table as well as pay for her children’s education.

The grocery store in which she mostly sells vegetables was started with savings from a farm that Immaculate still operates, though it’s now secondary to her main enterprise. In a month she makes 100,000 UGX in profits. With this loan Immaculate is looking at the prospect of buying more vegetables to sell. Immaculate attributes her progress to hard work and determination.

loans.use: The purchase of more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Doracy

texts.en:
Doracy moved to the US with hopes of replicating the lingerie store that she owned in Brazil. After attempting door to door selling for a time, she was able to save enough money to open her own storefront in 2006. She also expanded her business to include a thriving online shop. She has continued to grow her business to include formal dresses which she sells most of during graduation season. 

This is Doracy’s fifth loan with ACCION USA. She used her previous loan to move her business to a better location which greatly improved her business. With her new loan she wants to purchase more merchandise to prepare for the Christmas season.  This is her busiest season and she wants to be fully stocked for the holiday rush. 

Moving forward, Doracy hopes to continue to grow her business and eventually open a second store and perhaps move into a mall. Her goal for this upcoming year is to see her daughter graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna U. (pictured above), 25, is a motorcycle repairman. His wife, Mrs. Rann Horn, 28, stays at home and takes care of their children. The couple has been married since 2006 and have one son and one daughter. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Veasna is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase additional motorbike spare parts to respond to his customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional motorcycle spare parts for his motorbike repair business

loans.name: Lê

texts.en:
N. Lê Thị (2020103009) is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, N. owns & operates a restaurant where she serves a variety of different meals to customers in the local community.  N. has been engaged in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3.300.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.  The loan will be N.'s 5th loan from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Lê Thị (2020103009) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ phục vụ nhiều bữa ăn khác nhau cho khách hàng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 18 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.300.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn & đồ uống cho nhà hàng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn & đồ uống cho nhà hàng.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Nerry

texts.en:
Nerry O., 58 years old, is from the town of Santo Niño. She is married and has 3 children ages 18, 17 and 15. She works hard to sustain her children's education. Two of her kids are in college and she hopes for them to graduate and find appropriate jobs. 

Nerry is a farmer. She and her husband own land that they cultivate. They plant rice crops and sell their harvest to the market. Nerry wants to increase their harvest so she does her best to keep the crops healthy. Her farm still needs fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, a KIVA partner. This loan will help her farm immensely.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
This is Girlie O., 25, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, and together they have three children, one of whom is already starting his elementary school while the other two are still toddling around at home. By the grace of God, Girlie has managed to support her children's schooling and living expenses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday needs.

Girlie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Girlie dreams of being able to expand her business and live a healthy life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 43 years old, married, has six children and lives in her own home in Kasese, Uganda. For the last 20 years, she has run a beauty salon where she shapes and treats hair. Her goal is to have the most popular salon in town, and she has applied for a loan to make this possible by buying a hair dryer and more of the beauty products she uses in her business.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and beauty products for her salon

loans.name: El Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
El Progreso 1 & 2 (Progress) is a group of ten people who are all requesting loans with Kiva partner, Esperanza International, and taking a step to improve their businesses. This group comes from an extremely poor area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic. The majority of this group do not have a steady income, and they are looking to start small businesses to change that fact. The group is very excited about this opportunity, and they are ready to get started on their businesses.
Rhut is the representative of this group. She is planning on investing in her business selling shoes and miscellaneous products. She is the mother of three young children, and she wants nothing more than to be able to provide them with a comfortable life. She dreams of sending them to university someday. Rhut is an extremely hard worker who will find a way to make her business work. She is excited to finally be getting a chance, and she admits that opportunities like this haven't come her way often. She is ready to take this next step towards a better life!

loans.use: To buy shoes and other products

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 48 year-old Ibrahim K.. He is married, and has 5 children ages 3, 5, 8, 12 and 14. In 1981, Ibrahim established his used clothes and bags business. He began his business because he wanted to earn a profit to support his family. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about Le 540,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to increase stock for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to educate his children, improve his sales stall and build a house. He is very serious and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional assorted used items.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa Y. cooks rice and serves it with tomato sauce at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been cooking food for sale for 11 years. She is married and has three children. Her husband repairs faulty televisions. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family, such as food, clothing and shelter. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to buy other foodstuffs to cook to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a cafeteria.

In this picture, Adjoa is dishing out some of the cooked rice. To her right is the tomato sauce.

loans.use: buy other foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Houevi  Amivi

texts.fr: Madame  Amivi   est mariée et a 26 ans. Elle est  revendeuse  de chaussures et  boissons alcoolisés. Elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché  de  Lomé  et les revend   au marché local  d’awatamé.  Elle compte dans cette activité  2 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter  35 paires  de  chaussures, 2  cartons  de  dry  gin  et 4 cartons  de pastis.
texts.en:
Madame Amivi est mariée et a 26 ans. Elle est revendeuse de chaussures et boissons alcoolisés. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et les revend au marché local d’awatamé. Elle compte dans cette activité 2 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter 35 paires de chaussures, 2 cartons de dry gin et 4 cartons de pastis.

Mrs. AMivi is 26 years old and married. She sells shoes and alcoholic beverages. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells at the local market of Awatamé. She has been in this business for two years. She is seeking a loan to purchase 35 pairs of shoes, two boxes of dry gin and four boxes of pastis.

loans.use: Purchasing shoes and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Wilber Armando

texts.es:
Wilber, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su esposa María Esperanza y sus tres hijos: Wilber de 13 años, Dilver de 11 Y Bryan Isaac de 9 años de edad; Él se dedica a un taller de estructuras metálicas  y una tienda de productos de uso domestico, estos negocios los administra en su casa de habitación, en el taller realiza los trabajos solicitados para luego transportarlos donde los clientes.
Actualmente necesita un  préstamo para comprar materiales como Hierro, también para la tienda comprara productos como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, maíz, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su trabajo en los dos negocios.
Para Wilber el objetivo primordial y por el que cada día se esfuerza trabajando es construir su propia casa donde pueda vivir su familia en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Wilber lives in San Francisco Gotera, department of Morazan. He is 33 years old and lives with his wife Maria Esperanza and their three children: Wilber, 13, Dilver, 11, and Bryan Isaac, 9. He makes metal structures and has a grocery store. He runs these businesses out of his home; for the metal work, he completes the orders in his home and then delivers them to customers.

He now needs a loan to purchase material such as iron, and for his store he will buy items such as beans, rice, sugar, and corn. This investment will help him improve both his businesses.

Wilber's main goal, and the reason he works so hard every day, is to build his own home where he can live with his family in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as iron and domestic items such as beans, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to refurbish a motorcycle taxi and sell clothes.

loans.name: Enrique Antonio

texts.es:
Enrique, tiene 39 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa, reside en Santiago de María, vive ahí con su esposa y dos hijos, uno de 14 años y el otro de 4 años de edad; El negocio lo inicio hace 8 años, lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Santiago de María, su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
El necesita de un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir como: blusas, faldas, camisas de vestir, pantalones y ropa interior, esta compra será un buen avance para el negocio, ya que contara con diversidad de productos nuevos, por parte de los clientes, pues encontraran lo necesario para vestir.
Él considera que la inversión le traerá desarrollo en el comercio, logrando fortalecerse y garantizándose en el mercado a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Enrique is 39 years old and lives in Santiago de María with his wife and two children.  One of his children is 14 and the other is 4.  Enrique owns a clothes business which he started eight years ago.  It is located in Santiago de María town market.  He works from 7.00am to 4.00pm.

Enrique needs a loan to buy clothes such as blouses, skirts, dress shirts, pants and underwear.  This purchase will be a step forward for his business since it means he will have a variety of new products and his customers will be able to find what they need.  Enrique believes that the investment will help him make progress in his business, strengthening it and guaranteeing his place in the market in the long term.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dress shirts, pants and underwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Anita De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Anita D. los Ángeles, D. 44 años D. edad, habita en casa  propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Anita posee una pequeña panadería en su hogar D. habitación en la cual elabora y venD. pan dulce. Ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia y lo que más quiere es poder darles una mejor calidad D. vida. Ella es muy conocida en la zona ya que se caracteriza por ser amable y mantener variedad D. pan dulce al mejor precio y calidad. 

Últimamente ha notado que la demanda D. sus productos ha incrementado y esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito para poder comprar más materia prima como: harinas, azúcar, canela, colorantes, aceite, etc. Con la fe puesta en Dios que D. esta forma lograra cumplir su sueño y podrá ofrecer mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Anita D. los Ángeles is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and four children.  She has a small bakery in her home where she produces and sells sweet bread.  Anita has worked all of her life so that her family can get ahead.  What she wants most is to give them a better quality of life.  She is well-recognized in her area and known for being friendly and maintaining a variety of quality sweet bread at a good price.  

As of late, Anita has noticed that the demand for her products has increased.  Therefore she has decided to request a loan in order to buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, cinnamon, food coloring, oil, and other products.  With her faith in God, Anita is on her way to fulfilling her dream and providing a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making sweet bread, including flour, sugar and cinnamon.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 37 years old. He is married and the father of two children. He owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue it generates.

Rovshan is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase his stock. Rovshan is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to increase his stock.

loans.name: Dora Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Dora tiene como actividad la venta de ropa nueva jeans y chamarras del mismo material, ella vende en una populosa zona de el alto de la paz, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo y sus dos hijos, el esposo trabaja en el exterior del país de donde manda remesa para su familia, el destino del crédito es para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo con la compra de mercadería  al por mayor ya que se acerca la época de frio y ella desea comprar ropa de invierno ya que sus clientes ya le hacen pedidos, es una persona muy amable que sola se esta encargo de su familia por la ausencia de su esposo, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dora's business is selling new clothes, jeans and jackets made from the same material.  She sells her products in a busy area of El Alto, La Paz.  Her family consists of her husband and her two children.  Her husband works abroad and sends money home to his family.

Dora will use her loan to increase her working capital, buying merchandise wholesale, as the cold season is approaching and she would like to buy winter clothes since her customers are already placing orders with her.  Dora is a very kind person who is solely in charge of her family, owing to her husband's absence.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (winter clothes)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school, while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 3 years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling by retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business and sell by wholesale. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal of sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal of sale.

loans.name: Houmalabé

texts.fr: Jeune femme mariée de 26ans et mère de deux enfants, Houmalabé est revendeuse de charbon de bois devant son domicile depuis 2005 et pour les besoins de son commerce elle s’approvisionne à Sotouboua. Son mari est menuisier  et pour l’aider dans le ménage, elle se bat au quotidien pour supporter les dépenses  du foyer. Elle aimerait augmenter son stock  et pour cela elle sollicite ce crédit auprès de notre institution pour acheter 150 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en: Houmalabé is a young lady, aged 26, married and the mother of two children. She has been selling charcoal in front of her house since 2005. She gets the supplies for her business in Sotouboua. Her husband is a carpenter and to help him with household expenses, Houmalabé struggles hard day after day to provide for the family. She would like to increase her inventory and therefore she came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 150 sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José es padre de familia de 33 años, vive con su esposa  y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 16 años labora brindando los servicios de carpintero, trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche para poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de madera, herramientas, lijas, martillos clavos, pega y maque lo que le permitirá ofrecer mejores servicios y realizar la entrega pedidos que le han realizado. Pedro es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades académicas en un futuro.
texts.en: Pedro Jose is the father of a family, 33 years old, and he lives with his wife and their 3 children. For the past 16 years he has been providing carpentry services. He works every day from 7am to 9pm to provide for the daily needs of the family. He has requested a loan to purchase wood, tools, sanders, hammers, nails, glue, and lacquer. It will allow him to offer better services and to fill orders that have already been placed. Pedro is a very hardworking and responsible person. The only thing that he wants is for his children to have better academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wood, tools, sanders, hammers, nails, glue, and lacquer.

loans.name: Etheljen

texts.en:
Etheljen is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Etheljen has a junk shop that buys and sells recycled plastics and bottles. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional recyclable products and junk to sell.

Etheljen is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Etheljen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional recyclable products and junk to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos  de 28 años, se dedica  en la ciudad de Barranquilla a una actividad comercial mediante la cual vende ranchos, víveres, bebidas y en general productos de la canasta familiar entre los habitantes del barrio donde habita con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 1 s 9 años. Su meta personal es seguirse superando permanentemente y lograr bienestar para su familia, mediante la adquisición de su vivienda. 
Carlos muchos años atrás se había dedicado a la albañilería e  la ciudad de Bogotá, pero en el año 2009 regresó a Barranquilla motivado por la enfermedad de su madre, quien tenía su negocio Minitienda Daniela  a la que hoy Carlos se dedica.  Sus principales clientes están ubicados en el barrio donde vie y en los alrededores de él, realiza sus compras  de contado y en pequeña cantidades,  así como sus ventas son la mayor parte de contado y una porción a crédito.   Sus inventaros rotan cada 18 días y  sus cuentas por cobrar cada 2.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen productos como arroz, aceite, azúcar y bebidas, con ello ganará descuentos por la compra de contado y en un mayor volumen que el usualmente acostumbrado.
texts.en:
Carlos is 28 years old. He works in the city of Barranquilla as a merchant. He sells groceries, beverages and general products for the family basket to the inhabitants of the neighborhood where he lives with his family. He is married and has 5 children, aged 1 to 9 years old. His personal goal is to keep getting ahead and achieve his family's wellbeing through getting a house. 
 
Carlos worked as a bricklayer many years ago in the city of Bogotá. In 2009 he returned to  Barranquilla because his mother was ill. She had the Mini-Store  Daniela where Carlos works now. His main customers are located in the neighborhood where he lives and nearby. He makes his purchases upfront and in small quantities and he makes his sales mostly upfront and some on credit. His inventory turns over every 18 days and his accounts payable are every 2 days. His Kiva loan is the first loan he has made with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it he will buy products in in greater volume such as rice, oil, sugar and beverages. With it he will get discounts for paying up front and in a larger quantity than he usually does.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, oil, sugar and beverages in greater quantities.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 32 years old, is married to a petty trader and has a 3-year-old child. He has an additional dependent (his brother) who lives with him. Joseph has been operating a telephone center and selling recorded DVD plates for the past two years. This business has helped him to get adequate income to meet his and his family's needs. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day. Joseph earns about SLL 900,000 monthly from this business.

Joseph has a very good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to buy mobile phone credit cards and recorded DVD plates. He hopes that this loan will increase his monthly profit by SLL 300,000. In the future, Joseph plans to educate his daughter to the highest possible level and to build a house for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone credit cards and recorded DVD plates

loans.name: Janny Marleny

texts.es:
Janny de 27 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de alta actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Desde hace unos años Janny se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá solventar sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza y aves de corral porque quiere iniciar en otro negocio, para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Janny es una mujer trabajadora y una madre que siempre trata que su familia salga adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Janny is 27 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own house, where the only service they have is lights. It is located in a rural zone in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the department of Piura. This is a zone where the main activities are agriculture, livestock, and arts.

Since several years ago, Janny has been selling beauty products by catalog. She runs her business in her home and has her own customer base. With the income she earns, she is able to meet her family's needs.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more beauty products, as well as poultry birds.  She would like to start another business to offer her customers and to gain more income, so that she can have a better quality of life. Janny is a hard-working woman and a mother who is always trying to get her family ahead, despite the difficulties that life sometimes presents.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds and more beauty products

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Angelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Angelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Angelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tsedevdorj

texts.en:
Tsedevdorj is 25 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. His older son is 8 years old, a elementary school student and other son is 3 years old. His wife runs a small shop. 

He started his business in 2006 by driving a taxi. He purchased his car by paying 16,000 MNT per day from April 2010 to March 2011. He is planning to expand his business. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says "I took a loan of 1,200,000 MNT and used it for the right purpose." He knows how to manage the loan and pay on time. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials to build a garage at his home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: El señor Raymundo  es  una persona  muy trabajadora  el cual   actualmente  tiene una  tienda   de  abarrotes   la  cual  le  a permitido  salir  adelante, su mayor   sueño  es  ampliar   su  negocio  por  lo  que  requiere   realizar  la compra  de mercancía  para  de esta  manera   continuar  brindándole a sus  clientes   el excelente  servicio  que lo a  caracterizado  ,  ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  obtener  mayores  ingresos y  seguir   brindándoles   una excelente  estabilidad  económica  a sus  hijos además  de proporcionarles  la oportunidad   de  que  se  superen  día  con día   lográndoles  pagar  sus estudios.
texts.en: Raymundo is a very hardworking person who has a grocery store at present that’s helped him to get ahead.  His greatest dream is to expand the business and this is why he needs to buy merchandise to continue providing his customers with the excellent service that has characterized him.  He sees in the loan the potential of earning higher income and to continue to provide his children with excellent economic stability as well as the opportunity for daily self-improvement by paying for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: C4811 Amizeroyacu Group

texts.en:
Isaie is 22 years old and married with one child who is six months old. Isaie is the leader of a group called "Amizeroyacu" and this group is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes, vegetables, tomato sauce, rice, etc. Isaie has four years of experience and his business hours are from 6 am until 1 pm every day. Isaie is the first person on the right side in the photo.

Isaie and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing more goods (soap, rice, sugar, vegetables, Irish potatoes, tomato sauce) to sell. If successful, Isaie and his team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and improving their family lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like soap, rice, sugar etc.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her seat-cover making business. She prepares motorbike and bicycle seat covers and is an expert in her work. With the loan she will buy raw materials such as leather and thread in larger quantity to be able to prepare better quality seat covers.

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for many years. She is confident that a loan investment will help her expand her business further.

She is a widow and has two sons and a daughter. After the death of her husband, she worked very hard to raise her children. All of her children have studied till the intermediate level and now do different kind of work to financially contribute to the family.

loans.use: to buy thread and leather for seat-cover making business

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 2 children. For the past 3 years, Mastula has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids, and will help Mastula to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Mastula hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her savings. 

Mastula is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Mastula, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids

loans.name: Fallou

texts.fr: Monsieur Fallou est âgé de 40ans. Il est célibataire et vit au Sénégal depuis plusieurs années. Depuis plus de 5 ans il gère une quincaillerie. Avant de pratiquer cette activité il évoluait dans la maçonnerie. Actuellement il a choisi son activité sous l’influence de son grand frère qui détenait une quincaillerie. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est la connaissance qu’il acquiert des pièces et aussi les revenus que lui génère cette activité rentable. Il est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il pratique son activité depuis 2009. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits  destinés a renforcer son magasin. Il souhaite élargir son activité, développer son commerce, augmenter  ses bénéfices et améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en:
Fallou is 40 years old, single and has lived in Senegal for several years. He has been running a hardware store for over 5 years. Before that he was a mason, but he was persuaded to change career by his brother, who had his own hardware store. Fallou especially likes learning about the products he sells and also enjoys running a profitable business.

Fallou has been a member of his local UIMCEC branch since 2009 and is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs in order to restock on hardware items for his store. He would like to develop and expand his business in order to increase his profits, which he will use to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to restock on hardware products for resale.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme  âgé(e) de 39 ans. Afi est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. 
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et de céréales depuis 2001. Afi vend seule à ses clients au marché. Sa difficulté principale est le retard dans la livraison. 
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et des céréales. Afi veut réinvestir dans l’activité avec les profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait augmenter son fonds de commerce. Afi dit qu’avec les profits, Afi prévoit améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Afi is a 39 year old woman.  She is single and has no children.  Afi has worked as a charcoal and grains retailer since 2001.  She sells her products by herself to her customers at the market.  Her main difficulty is with late deliveries.  Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of charcoal and grains.  Afi wants to re-invest in her business with the profits she makes.  Over the next few years, Afi would like to increase her business.
 Afi says that with her profits, she plans to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Acheter des charbons de bois et des céréales

loans.name: Saitua

texts.en:
Saitua is 40 years old and is married with 6 children.

Saitua owns & operates a transportation business venture (taxi service).  She has one year of experience in this business.  Saitua needs a loan of WST $1500 to maintain the vehicle.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Saitua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Saitua's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to repaint a vehicle

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice, 35 years old, is married and has five children, all of them in school. She has operated a food stall business in Buluk. South Sudan, for five years. Rejoice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and oil. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Mabinty.  She is married and has two children, ages 13 and 8 years. She adopted two additional dependents.  In 2004, Mabinty established her air freshener, toothpaste, bathing soap, powder, baby oil, etc. business. Her foster parents introduced her to this business.  She later got married when she was fully matured.  Her husband was a petty trader by then and she saved the commission he received on each item.  She used this commission to start her own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,697,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy cartons of cream, toothpaste, Vaseline, and baby oil. In the future, Mabinty plans to develop her piece of land, provide quality education for her children, and also improve the business.  This loan will help to generate more income.  She is a hardworking and honest business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food market for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace was born 50 years ago, married with 5 children. Her last born is in secondary school. Grace dedicates part of her day to God’s work. She believes that people must participate in God’s work for he is the provider. She is a member of PCEA church in Nkoroi and the Chairlady of the Woman’s guild, the leader of the boys and girls brigade. Also she is a Sunday school teacher. She also heads the Oloika district as a Deacon. Disciplined and time conscious, she is able to do her church duties with a lot of dedication and thoroughness. She is the secretary of Oloika progressive women group, a very strong group whose books are well kept. Grace has been keeping poultry for many years. She keeps 400 layers at a time. She has a good market in Nkoroi which is an upcoming busy trading centre. She sells the eggs to her neighbors and also in the many kiosks that have come up. Grace has employed one person who assists her to run the project. Grace uses poultry manure in her two plots of land to where she grows maize. She sells the green maize at Kiserian market and gets some extra income. Grace would like to put up an extra poultry house that will house 400 more layers to enable her rear more chicks. With an average of 700 layers at a time, she will be able to supply eggs to Nkoroi, Kandisi, Rimpa areas (all these are upcoming busy trading centers and the demand of farm products is high). She intends to buy a bicycle so as to make the distribution work easier and faster.

loans.use: Grace wants to build a new house for the chicken, buy extra 400 layers, and buy a bicycle to transport eggs.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel M. is a computer engineer, married and father of one son. He will invest the money from the loan by PRISMA to buy 5 computers which will enable him to modernize his cyber cafe, which is located next to a University. This location generates a large clientel and is also a great opportunity to augment his earnings and to promote his services as a computer-repair specialist.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Manuel M., ingeniero en computación, casado, padre de 1 hijo, invertirá el dinero otorgado por PRISMA, S.A en la compra de 5 computadoras que le permitirán modernizar su cyber café, el cual se sitúa al costado de una universidad, lo cual le representa una gran afluencia de clientes y por lo tanto una gran oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos y promover sus servicios de mantenimiento y reparación de computadoras.

loans.use: The loan money will be invested to buy computers to modernize the ownner's cyber cafe and to promote his services as a computer-repair specialist.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin V. is a 60 year old widow with 4 children.  She also has 4 nieces and nephews that live with her, making the total household size 9 people.  Two of her children are mototaxi drivers, and she would like to use this loan to buy a new mototaxi for her nephew to drive.  Once the household gathers enough savings from the new mototaxi, Chin V. will build a small coffee shop (seriously lacking these in Phnom Penh!).  She is confident that the shop will earn her family enough money so that all the children may complete university.

loans.use: To buy a mototaxi and wood to build a new coffee shop

loans.name: Cheri Maiya

texts.en:
Cheri Maiya M., 34 year old, lives in Thecho Nepal. . Thecho is one of the under developed villages of Nepal. Most of the People of this region are poor and work in the farm. 
She lives in single family with her husband and two sons. Mrs. M. and her husband, Dil Bhakta M. both make brass religious statues. They have 14 years of experience in making statues. Her older son is in grade 7 and younger son is in grade 5. 
She seeks $375 to purchase raw materials for making brass religious statues. In Nepal the cost of education is very high. So she is planning to spend her income for better education of her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for statue making

loans.name: Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Kumari S., 37, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur, with her husband and three sons. Her economic condition is not good, so she can't send her children to a good school. Mrs. S.'s husband, Mr. Narayan S., is a taxi driver and owns his own taxi. Her older son took the SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam this year, and the other two sons are in grades 6 and 4.

Mrs. S. opened her cosmetics shop two years ago. Now she seeks a loan of $225 to buy cosmetic goods such as chura (glass bangles), cream and powder to improve her business. She wants to use her income to help her husband and fulfill the family's basic needs, and she also wants to save some money for further study for her children.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Lwanga

texts.en:
Lwanga is 40 years old, single, and has 6 children. She also takes care of her mother. For the past 8 years she has run the Mama Nalkianga Restaurant in Kayunga. She is very courageous and determined. She has limited space and the structure needs improvement. But her food is prepared very well and she has a strong business clientele. She serves typical Ugandan dishes of steamed bananas, rice, posho and cassava.

She dreams of making sure her children get a good education and eventually buying a plot and building a home. For now she plans to use her loan to buy more foodstuffs for the restaurant and pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant and pay school fees.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Three years ago Agnes was working as a seamstress, but the income was not enough to support herself and her 4 children, so she decided to start her own business making peanut butter. It was a good business to start because it required only a small amount of start-up capital. She fries the peanuts, and then takes it to the public mill to grind them. The only issue is the cost of the peanuts. She would like to buy peanuts in bulk to reduce the price. If she receives the loan, she will be able to buy two sacks of peanuts.

Agnes says that her goals are all strictly for her children to receive higher education. They are still in junior high and primary school, but Agnes already has plans for all of them to attend university.

Agnes is a member of an Obuasi lending group in the market. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Many of the members have businesses close to each other in the market and have developed strong relationships over the years. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es:
Paulo is 52 years of age and his wife is 51. They have four children: two boys and two girls, who work at home helping take care of their cattle and, at the same time, studying.

Don Paulo is an ambulant seller of artisanal products like hammocks, quilts and table cloths. His wife is a seamstress of these products. As such, they are a team since she sews the quilts and hammocks and he sells them by going house-to-house.

Considering that sales are increasing, Paulo wishes to acquire a greater quantity of merchandise. In this manner, he will sell what his wife produces and also other crafts of the area. Paulo is soliciting a credit in order to purchase more quilts and hammocks.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Paulo tiene 52 años de edad y su esposa 51, tiene cuatro hijos, dos varones y dos mujeres, trabajan en la casa ayudando a cuidar de los ganados vacunos que tienen y a la vez estudian.

Don Paulo, se dedica a la venta ambulante y a crédito de artículos artesanales como hamacas, colchas y manteles; y su esposa es tejedora de estos productos; así entre ambos son un equipo ya que la señora teje las colchas y hamacas y Paulo las vende recorriendo casa por casa.

Considerando que las ventas aumentan cada vez más, Paulo desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de esta forma venderá lo que su esposa produce y también de otras artesanas de la zona. Para adquirir mas colchas y hamacas, es que Paulo solicita el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of quilts, hammocks and tablecloths.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Doña Raquel is a member of the community bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” and for a living she sells clothing and footwear (which she brings from the town of Trujillo). Her business is located in the town of Huaraz, department of Ancash. With the loan of S/.2,300.00 ($800), to be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 2 ½ dozen jackets for men and women, 4 dozen ankle boots, 12 dozen boots, and underwear for men, women and children.

She is 30 years old, married, with no children. Her husband is dedicated to wholesale and retail of eggs and both work to run their household.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Raquel pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado (que los trae de la ciudad de Trujillo). El negocio está ubicado en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300.00, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 2 ½ docenas de casacas para damas y caballeros, 4 docenas de zapatos tipo botines, 12 docenas de botas, ropas interiores para damas, caballeros y niños.

Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de huevos al por mayor y menor y ambos trabajan para sacar adelante a su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and footwear to increase sales.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Victoria C. is a member of the Loreto Communal Bank, located on Jr. Oscar R. Benavides N° 989, Calleria district, in the department of Ucayali. She is a 49-year-old mother of 8, and her husband is a teacher and mechanic. With the loan of S/ 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to set up a small shop that offers private phone booths where calls are paid when completed.

She still has this phone and internet shop. She wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to do her household chores, then focuses on her business activities. Upon closing her shop, she rests in order to have enough energy for the next day.

With the loan of S/. 3,000 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will expand her business by purchasing 2 phone booths and telephones. She will also improve her business space, and buy paint and a photocopier.

Victoria feels that she has maD. progress working with Manuela Ramos, which helps her financial status. She is at a stage in life where she feels good about herself.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Oscar R. Benavides N° 989, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 49 años, es madre D. 8 hijos y su esposo es profesor y mecánico. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 deciD. invertir en un pequeño locutorio.

En la actualidad cuenta con un locutorio y cabinas D. Internet. Se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para hacer las tareas domésticas y luego se dedica a la atención D. sus negocios. Cuando cierra descansa para tener energías para el día siguiente.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, implementará el negocio con la compra D. 2 cabinas para locutorio y teléfonos. También hará modificaciones a su local y comprará pintura y una fotocopiadora.

Victoria trabajando con Manuela Ramos siente que esta progresando, es una ayuda para su economía y está en una etapa D. su vida que se siente muy bien consigo misma.

loans.use: Purchase of phone booths and telephones

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun Yek and his wife have been married since 2003. They have one little daughter. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Bunthoeun has been a mason for ten years. His wife has been working in a garment factory for eight years. Mr. Bunthoeun is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1,000 to add to the capital he needs to build his house.

loans.use: To build his house

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 33-year old mother with three children. She lives with her husband in Kisumu, Kenya, where she opened her retail shop in 1998. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, millet, groundnuts and green grams in small quantities to her customers. She also sells other essentials such as bread, rice, flour, sugar and cooking oil. Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation and experience, plus a well-established clientele base, ensure that her business will continue to grow despite stiff competition. She has applied for a loan of $800 to buy additional stocks of cereals in bulk. She will also save a portion of the loan for use in case unforeseen circumstances.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Gonzáles is 68 years old and lives in the La Libertad Urbanization in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. She has five children who are all independent. One of her daughters and her children live with her.

Rosa sells the following foods from her home: chocos (a food from the Liberteña mountains), sweets, and tamales. With the proceeds, she helps out with her expenses and some of her daughter’s. Despite her age, she is not afraid of work—quite to the contrary, she considers herself strong enough and with plenty of energy to continue working and earning a living. This also relaxes her and keeps her from feeling depressed due to the aches and pains that are normal at her age.

Rosa is a member of the “Unidas Para El Progreso II” communal bank. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 she invested in her cooking pot and cooking utensils.

With this loan of S/. 800.00 from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy ingredients for the foods she makes.

She aspires to continue to have the strength to work each day and help her daughter and also to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa González tiene 68 años de edad, vive en la Urbanización La Libertad en la Provincia de Trujillo La Libertad – Perú, tiene cinco hijos, independientes todos, viviendo ella con una de sus hijas y sus nietos. La señora Rosa vende en la puerta de su casa, chocos (alimento oriundo de la sierra Liberteña), dulces, tamales, con lo cual se ayuda para su manutención y aporta en algunos gastos de su hija. A pesar de su edad no se amilana ante el trabajo todo lo contrario se considera con fuerzas y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y poderse mantener, lo cual también la relaja y no le deja deprimirse por algunas dolencias propias de su edad. La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “ Unidad Para El Progreso II”. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 con lo cual pudo invertirlo en la compra de su olla y su cocina entre otros. Con el préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.800.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos. Aspira seguir con fuerzas para trabajar día a día y poder ayudar a su hija y para mejor su condición de vida.

loans.use: She will buy more ingredients for the foods that she makes for sale

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.en:
Muhtaram S. is 32 years old. She is married and she has four children. Her husband is a farmer. From a very young age, she has understood and recognized the value of hard work because she has had to deal with very difficult circumstances and various hardships in her life. Muhtaram is an extremely hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration, and she has always looked to provide extra income for the benefit of her family.

For approximately 8 years, she has been in the business of purchasing young cattle from the local market and fattening them up so that they can be sold in the local markets. More specifically, she wakes up very early each morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and thereafter selling them at the highest price possible at the local market. She started this occupation after her beloved aunt had recommended it and taught her about the business. Thanks to this activity, she is able to support her children so that they receive a good education. Indeed, she wants them to continue to receive a good education because she hopes that they will reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves.

With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $600, for the term of 12 months, to buy a calf in order to expand her business and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Please support this brave woman who has a great deal of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change her life.

loans.use: To expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions by purchasing a calf

loans.name: Fanny Maria

texts.es:
Fanny started selling snacks, but a neighbor was going to close her grocery store, and instead of closing it she transferred it to Ms. Fanny, currently she no longer sells snacks because she works full time on the grocery store which has been very successful.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy more products because she wants to stock school supplies and increase her paper inventory to be ready when classes season starts soon. With the loan this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Fanny comenzó vendiendo antojitos, pero una vecina iba a cerrar su papelería, y en vez de cerrarla se la traspaso a la señora Fanny, en la actualidad ya no vende antojitos pues se a dedicado 100% a la papelería ya que le ha ido muy bien.

ella necesita un prestamo por US S250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia para el proximo regreso a clases ya que desea surtir su papelería y contar con un inventario mayor para sus clientes. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: To buy products / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, ages 8, 4 and 2. She also takes care of a 19-year-old person. Zakia has owned a small grocery store since in 2007. She works from 7AM to 9PM each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales. Zakia hopes to get a loan to buy more food items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more food items for resale.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Née en 1971, madame Brigitte M. est une divorcée et mère d’un (01) enfant. Depuis son enfance, elle a pris goût au commerce de poissons fumés et de légumes, mais étant divorcée elle n’a personne pour l’aider à supporter son enfant  à part son petit commerce. Ainsi elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son activité commerciale et attirer beaucoup de clientèle et sortir sa famille de son état de pauvreté.
texts.en:
Born in 1971, Mrs. Brigitte M. is divorced and the mother of one child. Since childhood, she has enjoyed being in the business of selling smoked fish and vegetables, but as she is divorced, she has no one to help her support her child. She has only her little business. Thus she is requesting financing to expand her business and attract more customers so as to bring her little family out of poverty.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of smoked fish and vegetables

loans.name: Bella María

texts.es:
De 42 años, la señora María tiene su bodega hace 15 años, siendo la primera en el barrio, aunque esto no ha sido sinónimo de mejores ingresos, por lo que ha tenido que idearse otros medios de ingreso como la venta de cosméticos por catálogo de una conocida marca en el medio. La gran meta de la señora María es sacar adelante a su hija menor hija que cursa la primaria en el colegio.

Para lo cual necesita un préstamo de 600 soles en aras de incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindarle la tan añorada buena educación a su menor hija.
texts.en:
At 42 years of age, María has owned her shop for 15 years. Being the first in her neighborhood has not been synonumous with better earnings. As a result, she has had to come up with other means of income, such as selling catalog cosmetics from a namebrand. María's greatest goal is to help her young daughter, who is in primary school, get ahead.

For this, she needs a loan of 600 soles in order to increase her income and provide the much -missed good education to her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire the necessities for her shop, such as completing its construction, beer, as well as cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
O. Mahliyo is 39 years old, married and has three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships she has experienced in her life have taught her the value of work. For the last 12 years, she has bought young cattle in the local market for fattening and resale. Mahliyo is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength that many people admire and has always looked for a way to bring extra income to her home. Mahliyo has awakened early every morning to feed her cows and bulls ever since she was taught to do that by her beloved parents. 

Thanks to her hard work, she is able to support her children and give them a good education. Mahliyo wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have set for themselves. With this goal in mind, she has applied for a loan of $750 for 12 months to buy additional livestock. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength. Your generosity can help change her life.

loans.use: To improve her family's living conditions by buying livestock for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia D. is thirty nine years old. She is married with five children, two of them have successfully completed high school and the other three are still in school. Lydia enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. However, she is constrained by low capital to make meaningful progress. She requests this loan to purchase supplies for her store in order to increase profits. She believes that together with her good customer relation skills, the loan will enable her to realize her dreams. She is a member of the community group called Ephesians Trust Group. In her group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days. Her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. sells kitchen utensils and household items at the Uselu Market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 38 years old and is married with 3 children. She travels to Onitsha to purchase the goods that she sells in Benin City. 

She needs a loan of N30, 000 to purchase more kitchen utensils and household items to sell. She says "thank you" to everyone who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more household items and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 27-year-old single man, living in Kherbit Kanafar, in the Bekaa Valey. Jean started working as a farmer with his father six years ago. Jean needs to borrow $1,000 in order to buy seeds, in addition to preparing the land for cultivation.

loans.use: Buy seeds and prepare the land for cultivation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman.She has no children. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and buy more nuts for sale.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy more nuts for sale

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
La señora Dany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras”, vive en el Jr. Loreto/Moquegua, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 3 hijos, los 3 que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y fue motivada por su pareja, quien decidió emprender su negocio vendiendo refrigerios en su propia casa.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes;  y cuenta con un local especialmente  acondicionado en su propia casa.
Con el prestamo de S/2,500.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, y también útiles escolares como lapiceros, lápices, plumones, correctores, borradores, cartulinas y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Dany, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Dany G. R. belongs to the "Triumphant Women" Communal Bank. She lives in the Loreto/Moquegua neighborhood in the District of Bellavista, Department of San Martin. She is 30 years old and lives with her 3 dependent children and their father. Dany started with $95, and encouraged by her children’s father, began her business selling snacks from her house. Currently she sells groceries in a special area of her home. The loan of $800 will be paid in 6 months, and she will invest it in buying more products to stock her store. These include rice and sugar in bags, packaged toilet paper, milk, preserved fish in boxes, personal hygiene products, and cleaning supplies for the home. She will also sell school equipment like mechanical pencils, pencils, pens, correction fluid, erasers, poster board and varied products to maintain satisfied customers. She makes the decisions regarding the business profits. On a personal level, she says she is more sociable, more confident, and will be responsible for the payment of her loan. Dany is grateful to Manuela Ramos allowing her to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, toilet paper, preserves, milk and other products wholesale.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Mrs. Belen C., 42 years old, is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are studying. She is a fish vendor and her husband is a fisherman. She sell fish caught by her husband, and sometimes she gets some from their neighbors for her to sell in the market and gain more income. Mrs. C. is borrowing the loan amount of PHP 5,000 for additional capital for her existing business. Her hopes are to have her own stall in the market and to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy fish for her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is thirty-seven years old. She is a married woman who has seven children. Five of them are currently pursuing education in the junior and senior high schools. Theresa’s husband is a food crop farmer. Theresa and her family live at a family house in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business. 

Theresa trades in clothing materials and jewelry. She buys textile fabrics, bedspreads, and all kinds of brand new clothes, including ladies’ wear and men’s wear, from Accra, a nearby city, and sells them in her shop in the market square in her community. Theresa has been in this business for seven years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy more textiles to serve her customers. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and eventually make very good profits. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called "Abandenden" Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan

loans.use: To purchase clothes and jewelry.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa I. is forty-six years old. She is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. According to her, one of her children is currently in senior high school while the rest are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver. Hawa is a food vendor. She sells plantain chips. She fries them in her house and sells them by the roadside. She also hawks to sell. Hawa procures plantains and vegetable oil from the local market. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure plantains in bulk. Hawa is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy plantains

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. PEDRO, el es natural de Pilcopata, situada en el distrito de kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo, correspondiente al departamento del Cusco, correspondiendo a la entrada al parque nacional del Manu, a 8 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.

Aquí encontramos al socio que pidió permiso de su trabajo para apersonarse al la reunión del banco comunal, y lo acompañé a su centro de trabajo que estaba al frente de la reunión, entonces le tomamos la foto en pleno trabajo, ya reincorporado en su puesto, este socio tiene 2 hijos (13, 12) años es casado y el es obrero, se hace llamar el constructor,  el socio requiere el préstamo para poder implementar su tienda abarrotes, en la que su esposa administrara, ellos desean implementar su negocio y comprar en cantidades grandes, aceite, fideos, harinas, trigo, papa, maíz y otros productos que la zona no produce, para lo cual solicitan el préstamo.

El socio esta muy feliz y valora el préstamo otorgado, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro C. T. is a native of Pilcopata, located in the Kosñipata district of the Paucartambo province, department of Cusco. His town is near the entrance of the Manu National Park, located some 8 hours from the city of Cusco.

Here we have our client, who asked for permission at work so that he could attend the microfinance institute’s meeting. I joined him at his workplace, which was in front of the meeting place, so I took a picture of him while he was in the middle of work. Mr. C. has a wife and 2 children, ages 13 and 12. He is a construction worker who is known as “El Constructor.” He needs a loan so that he can establish his own general store, which his wife will manage. They hope to set up their business and purchase large quantities of goods, such as cooking oil, noodles, flour, wheat, potatoes, corn and other products that are not produced in the area, which is why they are requesting this loan.

Our client is very happy and values the loan that he has been given, committing himself to pay off his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish general store

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: A. Angèle est née vers 1981 à Sèdjè dans le Département de l'Ouémé.  Angèle est mariée et mère d’un seul enfant et cet enfant va déjà à l’école. Angèle habite depuis sept ans Fifadji, un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Economique de la République du Bénin. Il y a cinq ans que Angèle a commencé à faire le commerce de riz et de  l'huile végétale.  Angèle vend le riz et l’huile végétale en sac de 50Kg et en détaille et l’huile en bidon de 25 litres et en bouteille d’un litre.  Angèle s’approvisionne en riz et en huile végétal chez les fournisseurs de Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin ; parfois à crédit. C’est les sacs de riz de 50Kg et les bidons d’huile de 25 litres que Angèle achète. N’ayant pas suffisamment de moyens  financiers  pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Angèle est obligée de prendre une partie de ses produits à crédit. Pour parer à cet état de chose, Angèle s’est adressée à ALIDé pour avoir de prêt. Angèle a déjà eu un prêt de ALIDé. C’est la deuxième demande de prêt que Angèle vient de faire auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Angèle was born around 1981 in Sèdjè in Ouémé county. She is married and the mother of a lone child, who is already going to school. For seven years, Angèle has been living in Fifadji, a district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Angèle started working in commerce five years ago selling rice and vegetable oil. She sells rice in 50-kg sacks at the retail level, and she sells vegetable oil in 25-liter drums and in one-liter bottles. She stocks up through suppliers of Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin; sometimes on credit. What she buys are these 25-kg sacks of rice and 25-liter drums of oil. Lacking sufficient financial means to satisfy customer demand, she has to take some of her goods on credit. To deal with this situation, she inquired with Alidé to obtain a loan. She has already had an Alidé loan. This in the second loan that she has just gotten from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seven 50-kg sacks of rice and five 25-L drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Currently two are in school and three have passed away. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains a daily source of livelihood. She trades in cereals like bagged maize. She has been in business for the last five years now. She receives deliveries of stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply of maize. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy maize in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize and manioc

loans.name: Муяссар

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мадаминова, женщина торгует на базарах Костокоз, Лохути, Овчи калача платками, скатертями, полотенцами и т.д. Товар она закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить партию банных полотенце и благодарит кредиторов за поддержку.

loans.use: На закупку банных полотенцев.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica O. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. Monica is 33-years-old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Monica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and everyday products to the local community. Monica has run her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Monica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Monica is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding her business. This is the 4th loan Monica has requested from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expand the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn V. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari, or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About GDMPC:
