GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric A. sells video cassettes, music videos, and other CDs and DVDs at Castle near Nyankumasi.  Eric has received a senior high school education.  He is married and has two children. His wife is a trader. Eric has been selling video cassettes since 2005. He is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more videos, CDs, and DVDs to sell. He hopes to use the new profits to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more videos, CDs, and DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Sarah Nabukenya Group

texts.en: Sarah is 37 year married with four children aged between 4 and 17 years .All her children go to school .She resiseds and owns  a two roomed house where she stays with four peopleThe family has access to electricity and no piped water and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Sarah Doesn’t take care of additional family members. Sarah sells beers in Ndeeba Kabowa Zone and buys crates of beer from delivery trucks.  She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Sarah has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for eight years servicing her thirteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy morecrates of beer. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a fully stocked bar.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Julita P. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 43 years old. Julita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Julita owns & operates a "sari-sari" store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Julita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.\n\nIn 2007, Julita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julita has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Julita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business . 

About PMPC:  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Juvylin

texts.en:
Juvylin M. is involved in a direct-selling business where she sells products of Avon, Natasha, and MSE. She sells through a door-to-door basis with her brochure and little items of personal products.

Juvylin hopes to bring with her more products of Avon, Natasha and MSE to sell to her loyal customers. According to her, she needs additional revolving capital for her retailing business. She hopes to obtain a loan of Php 7,000 for her to purchase more items. Her loan will be of great help in making her business more profitable and that’s why she really hopes for its approval.

Juvylin is 34 years old and is married to Franeo who has been working as a taxi driver in Manila for eight years so they’ve been away from each other for the welfare of their children. Engaging in a retailing business is her own way to help her husband in providing for the needs of their children.

Juvylin believes that through their hard work and sacrifices they can achieve their goals in life.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Mirelith

texts.es:
La señora Mirelth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas en Acción”, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas preparadas y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, lleva ya 03 años en el negocio y le va muy bien en sus ventas y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Mirelith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mirelith is a member of the communal bank called Shatojinas en Accion, in the district of Shatoja in Dorado, San Martin. She is 34 years old and married with 2 children who depend on her. With the intention of helping with household costs, she decided to open a small cafe selling prepared meals and snacks, slowly gaining more experience along the way. She has now been running her business for 3 years, and things are going well. Over time, she has become well known and very well liked by her customers. She continues to run her business, personally attending to her customers with the good nature she is known for. With the new loan, she will purchase rice, sacks of sugar, various vegetables, eggs and chickens. She will also purchase a few kitchen utensils to replace what she has now, so she can offer better service to her customers. Merilith feels confident that her income will continue to grow, helping to provide her with a more tranquil life. She appreciates the organization of Manuela Ramos for helping her to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, chickens, eggs and utensils for her small cafe

loans.name: Oula

texts.en:
Oula is a 31-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Oula has owned a grocery store since 2008. She sells candies, canned food, beverage, etc. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store to be able to expand her stock and diversify her merchandise. It will help her answer her clients' needs. This is the first time that Oula has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and traders. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her products. Oula decided doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, as well as because she likes trading. In future, she plans to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Merry

texts.en: Merry is a 48-year-old married woman. She has children and her oldest child is now 23 years old. She wants to help improve her family’s living conditions, and she works hard to achieve that. She has invested in rice farming and has also tried raising pigs. She shares that she needs additional capital to keep her business going. She joined CEVI, and has requested to loan Php15, 000. She will use this loan to finance her farm and purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies & Animal Feed

loans.name: Jenneth's Group

texts.en: Jenneth B. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 39 years old. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Jenneth is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP monthly. In 2008, Jenneth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase some bags of hog feed to sell. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of hog feed to sell

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 27-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Two years ago, Nader decided to open mini-market in his region. He has been selling fruits and vegetables, all types of groceries such as candies, canned food, corn flakes, chips, pasta, rice, and lots more, as well as drinks and household cleaning products.

In order to provide the best for his customers, Nader has requested a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his market. This is the first time that Nader has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

Nader is speciA. in his business because he knows how to treat his customers, as well as having a good reputation. His customers are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face competition. Nader decided on doing his business because he always liked selling and wanted to have an independent job. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his shop so as to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. sells second-hand clothes at Abura near Cape Coast. Hawa has received senior high education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a driver.

Hawa has been selling second-hand clothes for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy second-hand clothes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Ana es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con su papa, Ana tiene un puesto alquilado en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas, y en las tardes estudia Historia en la Universidad.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos y casacas.
Ana sueña con tener un puesto propio y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Communal Bank “Azucenas” (Lilies). She is 22 years old, single, and lives with her father. Ana rents a vending post at the April 12th Market where she sells various types of clothing. She works every day in the mornings, and in the afternoons, she studies history at the university.

Ana is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN in order to buy trousers, polo shirts, and jackets. She dreams of having her own vending location and pursuing her career.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, polo shirts, and jackets

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto Díaz Hernández de 49 años de edad,  Labora como Supervisor de Vigilancia en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería de Managua, el tiene seis hijo a su cargo,  y cuatro de elloa  se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, es su tercer  crédito con CEPRODEL y este va hacer invertido en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción  como: cemento, arena, piedra, piedrin y hierro para la construcción de un cuarto en la parte de atrás de su vivienda.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Carlos dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su vivienda, por lo que ahora cuenta con una casa más segura.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto Díaz Hernández is 49 years old and works as security supervisor at the Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería (National University of Engineering) in Managua. He has six children under his responsibility (4 of them are school-aged minors) and is married. This is his third loan with CEPRODEL and it will be invested in improvements for his house which was facilitated by loans from CEPRODEL. The loan will be invested in buying construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, gravel, and wrought iron to build a room on the back of his house. All this work is with the objective of providing more security and a better quality of life for his children. Carlos said that thanks to the loans provided by CEPRODEL he has been improving his home and he now has a home that is more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: A. Cécile est née en 1970 à Zoungbomè, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Cécile vit depuis 20 ans à Missérété et est mariée à ODOU Moïse, un cultivateur. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Missérété. Cécile assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Cécile  n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Cécile produit de l'huile de palme, qu'elle vend au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Cécile se ravitaille en noix de palme au marché de Ouando. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Cécile sollicite un quatrième prêt, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa production, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Cécile A. was born in Zoungbomè, in the Ouémé region. She has lived in Missérété for twenty years, and is married to Moïse Odou, a farmer. The couple has three school-aged children who live with them in Missérété,and Cécile and her husband look after their family's needs. Cécile never attended school. For the past five years she has processed palm oil which she sells at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Cécile also stocks up on palm kernels at Ouando. She is an existing client of ALIDé and has already benefited from three loans from the organisation, all of which have been successfully repaid. She is seeking a fourth loan in order to strengthen her business and increase her production to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing palm kernels for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 38-year-old married man who has three children in school. He runs a retail shop and farms, together with his wife, to earn a living. Besides that, he is employed as a driver.

Peter is a member of a group called Kagwe Young Traders in Faulu Kenya. He joined this group so as to access financial support in terms of being guaranteed by the other members when he takes a loan.

Peter has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of sugar, cooking fat and maize flour in his shop. He hopes to expand his shop into a supermarket in the future.

Peter dreams of buying a plot and building a house for his family. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking fat and maize flour

loans.name: Artita

texts.en:
Artita G. is from the village of Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Artita owns and operates a motorcycle shop, although her main source of income comes from her work as a public teacher. Artita has been engaged in her motorcycle shop business for four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Artita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional materials for her shop. Artita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for the renovation of her house. This loan will be her second from PMPC. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials for house renovation

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia B. is from the village of Lower Langcangan. She is 46 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cecelia owns and operates a "sari-sari" (convenience) store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from this activity. In 2007, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Cecelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khuyen

texts.en: Khuyên Thị Nguyễn was born in 1976 and lives in Kim Tien village, which is part of Dong Anh town. She makes a living by growing rice and raising pigs. Khuyen has a daughter who is going to school, and her husband works as a contractor. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She is applying for her first loan from SEDA, which she will use to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to breed the pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married with five children.  All of her children go to school. She also takes care of her elderly mother.  She owns a stall selling secondhand clothes in Wandegeya, a neighborhood within the city of Kampala, Uganda's capital. She sells to all types of people, both retail and wholesale. Teddy buys secondhand clothes from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.  She goes shopping once a week.

Teddy wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.  She has been in this business for fifteen years. Besides this clothing business, she also gets additional income from rental rooms.  Teddy works seven days a week, and her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to go directly into importing these clothes.

Teddy decided to work with MCDT because they work with women who are in groups. Teddy resides in and owns a two-room house, and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Mercedes es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudiante de enfermería en un instituto, Mercedes sueña con estudiar 3 carreras como medicina, psicología, Mercedes tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes y frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, negocio que inicio hace 3 años. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de fideo, arroz, atún, aceite.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the community bank "Ccatarisum", which means "get up" in Quechua. Mercedes is single and lives with her parents. She is a nursing student at an institute. Mercedes dreams of studying 3 subjects such as medicine and psychology. Mercedes has a store in her home where she sells groceries, meats, and fruit, and she does this with help from her mother. She started this business 3 years ago. Her loan will be used to buy noodles, rice, tuna, and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, tuna and oil

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence has a boutique where she sells cosmetics and general household items such as candy, matches, and biscuits. She also has a small bar located on the side of the boutique where she serves drinks. Gaudence believes her business is successful because she sells a variety of items and her shop is the only one of its kind in the area. Her aspiration is to expand her shop to six times its current size after another year of operation. With the profits from her enterprise, Gaudence eventually hopes to open a restaurant.

Gaudence is a 28-year-old mother of an eight-month-old child. Her husband works in a bank.

loans.use: To purchase items for her general store

loans.name: Tanriverdi

texts.ru:
Tanriverdi M. 43 let. On jenat  imeyet 3 detey  dochka 12 let kotoraya zaniamyetsya tancami i uchitsya v shkole, sin 15 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom, i dochka 18 let kotoraya postupila v etom qodu v universitet. Tanriverdi i eqo semya yavlyayusta  oni  pereselenci in Fuzuli, Seychas projivayut v Fuzuli regione.

Tanriverdi uje 7 let zanimayetsya skotorvodstvom. On delayet sir i yoqurt iz moloka i prodayet na rinok. Teper on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit < calves> i uvelichit kolichestvo produkta dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Tanriverdi M. is 43 years old. He is married and has three children. His twelve-year-old daughter goes to school and studies dance. His son is fifteen, studies in school, and plays sports. His eighteen-year-old daughter entered the university this year. Tanriverdi and his family are refugees from Fuzuli and now live in the Fuzuli region. Tanriverdi has been a herdsman for seven years. He makes cheese and yogurt from milk and sells them at the market. Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy calves and increase the amount of product available to sell.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Blanca Josefina

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca Josefina C. vive las afueras de la ciudad Azogues que es la capital de la Provincia del Cañar, se halla localizada en la Hoya del río Paute,  su gente se dedica a tejer vestidos de  lana, alfarería, etc. Su iglesia que se encuentra en lo más alto de la ciudad siendo su principal atractivo turístico.

Doña Blanca tiene  49 años, es  casada y tiene 4 hijos de 24, 22, 17, 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos se dedican a trabajar y ayudan económicamente a su madre, también estudian en la universidad, su tercer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo estudia en la escuela, su esposo es mecánico y posee su propio taller, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad y fue construida gracias al trabajo y sacrificio conyugal.

La Señora Blanca se dedica a vender ropa por catálogo, lleva un año en este negocio, no tiene horario de trabajo ya que vende en su tiempo libre pues también se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito en la fundación y fue una amiga del banco comunal quien la incentivó a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en el compra de ropa para tener más variedad.
 
Su  sueño es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Blanca Josefina C. lives on the outskirts of the city of Azogues, the capital of the Cañar province, located at the mouth of the river Paute. Its people weave dresses, work in pottery, etc. Its church is located on the highest point and is the main tourist attraction. Blanca is 49 years old and has four children, ages 24, 22, 17, and 10. Her two oldest work and help her mother financially. They are also students at the university. Her third son attends the city college, and her youngest attends elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic and has his own garage. They live in their own home, which was built, thanks to their hard work and sacrifice. Blanca sells clothing through a catalog. She's been doing this for a year and doesn't have a regular work schedule. She sells in her spare time because she is also a homemaker. This will be her second loan through the foundation. She was a friend of the communal bank members, which motivated her to become a part of this group of entrepreneurial women. She will use the money from this new loan, though Fundacion Espoir, to invest in clothing in order to have a greater variety to offer. Her dream is to travel the world.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the village of Bato. She is 47 years old. Gloria is married and has three school-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a rice farm. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2006, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from PMPC, which was for 12,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

Gloria is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Одил проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Сейчас клиент предоставляет услугу, такси. Развозит людей с одного места на другое. Год как он занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Odil A. lives in Hamadoni. He is thirty years old, married, and has three children. He has a high school education. The client runs a taxi service. He carries people from one place to another. He has been doing this for a year. He is taking out a loan to repair his automobile.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Alexandra Judith

texts.es:
Alexandra de 32 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de accesorios cristianos. 

Ella asiste a una iglesia evangélica desde hace años y por eso decidió tener un pequeño negocio en la parte delantera de su casa de venta de accesorios cristianos. Vende cd, accesorios, biblias, camisas cristianas en su pequeña tienda, trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 16h00am de lunes a domingo. Para tener otro ingreso adicional ya que ayuda a sus padres económicamente trabaja en una empresa de atún llamada (NIRSA) en turnos rotativos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar biblias, accesorios, camisas para su negocio cristiano. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio de ropa interior y seguir ayudando a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 32, lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations with a wide variety of seafood.  She has a small store that sells Christian items.

She has been a member of an evangelical church for several years and this led her to set up a small business in the front part of her house selling Christian accessories.  She stocks CDs, accessories, Bibles and Christian shirts in her store.  She works from 7:30am until 6pm Monday through Sunday.  In order to have an additional source of income, because she helps her parents economically, she also works in a tuna processing plant, called NIRSA, on rotating shifts.

She will use the loan to buy Bibles, accessories and shirts for her Christian store.  In the future she’d like to have an underwear store and to continue helping her parents economically.

loans.use: For CDs, Bibles and t-shirts.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Эшпулатова Насиба проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Муж в России на заработках. Сама Насиба имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nasiba E. lives in the town of Turzun-zoda. She is 41 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband works in Russia. Nasiba has secondary education. She has been selling on the market for more than ten years. She rents out a vending stall where she sells fruits. Nasiba is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie D. is from the village of Corales, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Perlie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Perlie owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Perlie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year  and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Perlie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa B. is from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in mat weaving. She wants to buy more materials for making mats. In that way, she will be able to expand her business and earn a better income for her family.

She would also use the money to start another livelihood. She is interested in other income opportunities so that she can save more money for the educational expenses of her children.

The income of her business goes directly towards her family for buying food, clothes and other basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for making mats

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old and married to Catherine. They have been blessed with one child who is 10 years old. For the last three years Charles has been practicing horticulture, through which he earns monthly profits of Kshs 7,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by staff from Kadet and this is his first loan. He intends to use the loan to buy seedlings, pesticide and fuel for the water pumping machine.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to venture into dairy cattle rearing in the future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, pesticide and fuel

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  For 26 years, she has been doing tailoring in Kasawo-Kayunga.  Rose began her tailoring business after she received apprentice tailoring training at a tailoring school in the metropolis of Mukono. She sells most of the clothes she sews. School uniforms are her major specialty though she does not limit herself to only that. Rose also has a side soft drinks and pig husbandry business. These have provided supplemental income.  Her monthly profits are 700,000 shillings. With this loan, Rose is going to buy more cloth-making textile fabrics.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth-making textile materials

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mahmoud from Al-Ashrafia in Amman is 39 years old and the father of four children. He is a hard working man who runs a barber shop. 

He is requesting a 1,500 JOD loan and intends to use the amount to develop and expand his shop. Mahmoud also hopes to open another branch for his shop.

loans.use: To develop and expand his shop

loans.name: Help We Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you members of the “Help We” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Jeneba S. is the leader of this group. Jeneba is 31 years old and married with four children: two in primary school and two in secondary school. 

Jeneba sells palm oil, rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc., and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying the aforementioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc., in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 37 years old and is  married with three children aged between 7 and 16 years old.  Jacqueline sells various foodstuffs in her business such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.  Jacqueline has had her business for 16 years and employs five people.  Her business is open from 5am until 10pm every day. 

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance company in order to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil and so on.  With any profit, she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lilian Wambui

texts.en:
Lilian K. is 38 years old and is a single mother of two children. She operates a salon in Kawaha West for two years now and earns a profit of KES 8,000.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use entire loan amount to buy new clothes for the boutique shop and also buy some cosmetics for sale. She will invest the anticipated profits back into the business.

Lilian hopes to grow her business and in the future purchase a plot and build a home for her children.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for the boutique shop and buy some cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Agueda Juanita

texts.es:
Agueda Juanita P. M. tiene 47 años, es soltera vive con los  hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, arroz, maracayá en pocas cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Juanita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la venta de productos de yambal. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes, los productos de yambal los vende de puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz además para insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar la educación a los hijos.

Le gusta arreglar los fines de semana la casa y pasar jugando con los hijos.
texts.en:
Agueda Juanita P. M., 47, is single living with her children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has three children.

The “JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS” (We Progress Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which belongs to Chillanes canton.  It has 12 members primarily involved in short cycle farming of corn, rice and small amounts of passion fruit and in raising small animals like pigs and chickens.

Juanita is a corn farmer and also sells Yanbal brand products.  She buys her supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market; she sells the Yanbal products door-to-door.

She is asking for a loan to plant corn and rice and to buy farming supplies.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, diseases and weather variations. 

Her dream is to provide an education for her children.  She likes to spend weekends fixing up the house and playing with her children.

loans.use: To plant corn and rice and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Silvia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Silvia de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su tienda. Empezó a trabaja en el comedor de su mama y adquirió experiencia para administrar un negocio. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las20h00pm en su pequeña tienda de víveres. Pero quiere continuar con su tienda por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, snack, galletas etc. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y surtir con mercadería su tienda.
texts.en:
Silvia, 32, is a hard-working woman with a lot of aspirations for her store.  She started working in her mother's cafeteria and got experience running a business.

At present she works from 8 in the morning until 8 at night in her little grocery store.  But she'd like to keep her business going, so she wants use her loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, cookies, etc.  In the future she wants to stick with her business and stock up the store.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Veronica Margarita

texts.es:
Verónica, resiD. en Santiago D. María, departamento D. Usulután, tiene 34 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas y pupusas, vive con su esposo y sus hijos D. 8 y 3 años D. edad.
El negocio D. ella está ubicado en su propia casa, lo inicio hace 2 años, su horario D. venta es D. 10:00am a 9:00pm, por el momento su dificultad es que quiere incrementar su producción y no dispone D. la mercadería necesaria, para lo que solicita un préstamo y realizar las compras D. maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, aceite y gas, esta es la materia prima necesaria para la preparación D. la venta tanto D. tortillas como D. pupusas.
Las aspiraciones D. ella con respecto a la inversión es que contara con todo lo necesario para aumentar la producción, para lo cual espera que también le aumente la demanda y recibir mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Veronica, a resident of Santiago D. Maria, Usulutan department, is 34 years old and sells tortillas and 'pupusas' (a popular dish, based on tortillas and sausage). She lives with her husband and her young children, aged 8 and 3.

Veronica's business is located in her own home. She began the business 2 years ago. Her working hours are from 10:00 am until 9:00 pm. At the moment, her difficulty is that she wishes to increase production but lacks the necessary supplies. For that reason, she is requesting a loan to buy corn, sausages, cream cheese, cooking oil, and gas. These are the primary materials she needs to prepare and sells her tortillas and 'pupusas'.

Veronica's aspiration with respect to investment, is to be able to count on all the necessities to augment production, and she hopes that demand will expand as well and she will gain better earnings.

loans.use: TO BUY CORN, SAUSAGE, CREAM CHEESE, COOKING OIL, AND GAS

loans.name: Celinda Beatriz

texts.es:
Celinda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 46  años de edad.  Celinda es soltera y  tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con estudios superiores.
La señora se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará  mercaderías para su negocio como: tarjetas del día de la madre, flores, sabanas y prendas de vestir, ella trabaja sola en su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir–boutique bien implementada que le permita generar mejores ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo entre las socias.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of the Victor Echave Communal Bank, which is in the Puno district and department.  She is 46 years old, single, and has one child.  She has a post-secondary education.

She sells clothes.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  She invested her first loan, 300 soles, in her business.

She will use this new loan for 1,000 soles to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy items like Mother’s Day cards, flowers, sheets, and clothes.  She works alone in her business.

Her dream is to have a clothing store, a well-stocked boutique that will allow her to generate better earnings.

She likes the camaraderie among the members of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy Mother’s Day cards, flowers, sheets, and clothes.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr: Jhon, el socio tiene 34 años de edad, el socio es separado y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad, el socio trabaja como artesano y su especialidad es trabajos en melanina, el realiza muebles a pedidos y los expone en la plaza Tupac Amaru los días sábados y domingos, esta es una feria en la que se expone todo tipo de arte y comidas, el socio requiere l préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas, materiales para la venta de muebles.

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called RENACER (To be Reborn) and is located in Huanchac District which belongs to La Provincia, Cusco Department.

The member is Jhon, 34.  He’s separated and has two children who are 14 and 10 years old.  He works as a craftsman and his specialty is making things out of melamine; he makes furniture to order and displays them in the Tupac Amaru Square on Saturdays and Sundays.  This is a market where all sorts of food and crafts are displayed.  The member needs a loan to buy tools and supplies for his furniture sales.

He is grateful and wishes to express that he will repay in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, aged 29, is married to Isabela, and they are blessed with two children.

He sells curios in Kangemi, which he has been doing for three years. The business earns him a monthly income of 32,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy more curios for sale.

Peter hope to grow his business and join international exporters in the future.

loans.use: to buy curios for sale.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, tiene la edad de 52  años, está casado, el  vive con sus 2 hijos que son su prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia su cafetal. El cuanta con el terreno ya sembrado desde hace varios años y estaba un poco abandonada, el quiere es darle una mejora este año para poderle generar una buena cosecha este año. El quiere  seguirla asistiendo día a día y poderla  establecer en buenas condiciones de producción.  El tiene como meta generarle ganancias a su cafetal y así tener ingresos de este cultivo para su bienestar familiar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Freddy is 52 years old, married, and he lives with his 2 children, who are his priority. He plans on purchasing materials to help him maintain his coffee plantation. He has had an already established plantation for many years and it is somewhat uncared for. He wants to maintain it this year to have a better harvest. He wants to keep working on it day after day to establish good conditions for production. This is the first loan which he receives from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had any previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur has granted him a loan bearing greater benefits and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en: Rosanna is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Rosanna has a shop that sells snacks, detergents, beverages, and breads. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rosanna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Altanhuyag

texts.en: Altanhuyag is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a rented house in Uvs province, Mongolia. His older daughter, age 8, attends a local secondary school while his second daughter, age 6, is in kindergarten. His wife is a chef. Altanhuyg is a guard and works at a private company with monthly salary of 400,000 MNT. He has been able to save some money for a car in order to start a taxi service business. Also he is planning to buy a plot of land where he can have a house for his family. He is a polite and kind man who says, "I dream to have a house some day." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT to have enough to buy a car that will be used in his taxi service business.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to erect a concrete wall at the rear of her house.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mrs. Mey is a 30 year-old married woman with two kids who are attending public school. She earns a daily income by selling different kinds of wooden statues.  She typically makes a profit of approximately $3 each day. Mrs. Mey’s husband works as a driver and is earning an income of $3 per day. Mrs. Mey’s husband wants to independently run a motor taxi service, but he lacks capital to purchase his own motorcycle. To solve this situation, Mrs. Mey and her husband are asking for a loan of $500 that they will pool with their personal saving to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, age 37, is married with 4 children. She lives in Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosalinda sells canned goods and other daily use items such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc. to earn a living. She has had this business for 8 months. Each month, she earns 1,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase goods to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for 3 months. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to make her sari-sari store bigger and make her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase more stock  for her general store

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz’s husband is a butcher by profession. He provides fresh and good quality meat to his customers at very reasonable rates. His good services help him handle a good clientele base. Shahnaz is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is the mother of three children but none of them is able to attend school due to financial constraints.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats to be able to fulfill larger orders on time. Wedding season is near and Shahnaz is hopeful that her husband will be able to get great profits as a result of a loan investment. He has good experience in his business and has been operating it for the past 15 years. Shahnaz is confident about the positive growth of her husband’s business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 46 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumi que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadería.

Pedro desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y realizar arreglos en la cocina de su casa, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta de sus cabras puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Pedro es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente para contar con  otras comodidades.
texts.en:
Pedro, 46, lives with his family in his own home, which does not have basic services, located in the rural area of Mochumi district belonging to the department of Lambayeque. This area is characterized by crop and livestock farming. 

Pedro has for a number of years devoted himself to caring for and selling goats. His pens are located to the rear of his house and are appropriate and spacious. He feeds them with a commercially prepared feed and natural grasses, so that his animals may reach optimal growth in order to offer them at the various markets in the area and thus obtain much better earnings to cover daily living costs in his home. 

He has sought a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,500 Peruvian soles to purchase commercial feed for his animals and make repairs to the kitchen in his home. With the income he will receive from the sale of his goals he can cover the loan and improve the quality of life of his family. Pedro is a hardworking and very responsible person. His sole wish is that his family would improve itself economically in order to avail themselves of additional comforts.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals and make repairs to his kitchen.
